Reviews.Title: “Basileus is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Lindy1London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Basileus for 4 nights over Easter. Despite the hotel being full, the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. Our room was very comfortable, breakfast was good and we really appreciated all the guidance they gave us on visiting the sites, getting around and restaurants. Very good location too.

Reviews.Title: “at home atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ggel
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days at the Basileus, Yusef greeted us as if he had known us for a long time. He showed us where we would see the sights and some great places to walk, any questions we had he would answer or find out the answer. the breakfast was gigantic and tasty, we enjoyed it every morning, Great location, just 10 minutes from the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque etc. and the Tram was there too. Very safe area. The owners and staff were always there to chat, they enjoyed their guests as much as we enjoyed them.

Reviews.Title: “Good address”
Reviews.Author: NC_Lovers
Reviews.Content: A 10-minute walk from the Blue Mosque, conveniently located, although you can find more central than that. The hotel is pretty recent. Pleasant room, very friendly staff (family business), nice bathroom and lounge area. Only downside: had to have staff intervene as we could hear conversation next door from a loud bunch of girls as if they were sharing our room. The staff was extremely understanding and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, extremely helpful staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Denoise
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel are very good and we were not disappointed. The location of the hotel is about 5 minute walk from the main attractions in Sultanahmet. The room we stayed in was large, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff are amazing, very helpful, they really want you to enjoy your stay in Istanbul and go out of their way to ensure you do. We would definately recommend this hotel. Thank you for making our stay such a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part: The Staff”
Reviews.Author: DFraz0672
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but the room we stayed in had a dark mold stain on the ceiling that kept getting bigger and darker. This shouldn't be faulted too much by the hotel -- they said they were planning on fixing it soon and said we could move to another room if we wanted (plus they gave us a discount). The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood that's about 5 minutes walk from the main attractions in Sultanahmet, but the truly best part about the hotel was the attention to their guests. They were always eager to strike up conversation and help guide us to the best restaurants and things to do. When we had to leave at 3am the hotel had a specially prepared breakfast for us. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: seaglass22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our Istanbul vacation. I cannot say enough how helpful and nice the staff were. I believe Turks (outside of the major tourist zones) are very nice and hospitable in general but the staff here went above and beyond. The hotel is small like many others in Sultanhamet so you really get a lot of personal attention. After we arrived the man at the check in desk invited us to come down and gave us loads of really good recommendations on where to go, what to see, where to eat, etc. and labeled them for us on our map. I admit, at first I was skeptical that he was just plugging the businesses of his buddies, but after we tried a few of his recommendations out we found that his info was actually really good and helpful. We stopped back by the desk several times during our stay to ask additional questions and received the same sort of helpful and informative responses each time. The rate included an airport pick up and breakfast. The breakfast was great, traditional Turkish foods and made to order omelets. It isn't served in a fancy setting on a terrace or anything but the food is good. Wireless internet is also included and was very reliable and fairly fast. We took a double room and it was everything we needed. Very clean with a nice shower. The location is convenient for sightseeing in Sultanhamet as it is walking distance to the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque. I would say however that it is right on the edge of the major tourist area there which we liked. It allowed us to be able to go to a real local Turkish bath instead of one of the famous tourist ones (more pricey) but still be able to see the sights we wanted. Our return flight was overbooked so we actually ended up staying an extra night in a "5 star hotel" in Taksim paid for by the airline. The Basileus was better than the "5 star" in every way except the room was a little smaller. I strongly recommend the Basileus for anyone looking for a great hotel value in Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Secluded and clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: NCWorldTraveler1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is staffed by three very nice guys who were more then helpful in showing off the Old Town of Istanbul. The location is hard to find, even for taxi drivers but it is worth it. As a hotel, I would classify it as clean and affordable with comfortable beds. The breakfast is very good and they have a wide variety of things for such a small hotel. The hotel has 19 rooms for rent.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: babolat734
Reviews.Content: Basileus has been nothing but superb! Everything from the staff, to the location is beyond words! The great staff really helped make our trip wonderful! I highly recommend Basileus to anyone visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “This is what great hospitality should be all about”
Reviews.Author: jetsetpanda
Reviews.Content: I love to travel and to be honest I don't know why it took me this long to finally visit Istanbul. Besides its history which have left its indelible mark of different cultures, the city is an intoxicating assault on the senses. From the calls to prayer from the minarets starting at early dawn to the taste of the food and visual aesthetics of its buildings and crafts, everything about this place will mesmerize the first time visitor. For this trip Instead of staying in a reliable hotel chain I decided to look for something with character in the old city. I used tripadvisor to search for the top properties in Istanbul and the Basileus was a perfect fit for my needs. I sent an email requesting the days that I needed and received a quick reply from Ekrem and Yusuf advising that there was availability except for the last day of my stay. However, I was told that if there was any cancellation, I would be assigned a room automatically, otherwise they would find me an alternate hotel nearby. I accepted the offer and decided to take a chance on my last night. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet and the location was really convenient to all the major sights in the area. One thing that you notice upon entering the hotel is the lack of a front desk, but instead you see a desk and with two chairs like a regular office setting. This layout provides a more intimate and personal contact between the staff and guests. Omar was the person in charge the night that I came in. He quickly assigned me a room and personally showed me to my room while carrying my heavy bag. The hotel does not have an elevator which might be a bit challenging for those who travel with a lot of baggage, but staff is always ready and willing to assist. My room was nicely appointed and roomy enough for a single. The bathroom was pretty spacious for a room of this size with hair dryer and a good supply of toiletries. Slippers are also provided in the closet along with a safe. The bed was a bit on the hard side (which I prefer) and I slept comfortably throughout my stay. The next morning I went downstairs for breakfast and upon entering the small room I was greeted with a nice buffet display. There was a wide assortment of choices ranging from hot items like sausages, potatoes and made to order omelettes that are brought to your table to fruits, cereal, cold cuts and cheeses along with plenty of breads, fruits, olives, tomatoes and cucumbers, not to mention some crepes and fruit preserves. Frankly you can make a meal out of this generous display that will fuel you for at least half a day. As someone with a degree in hotel and restaurant management, I know that this industry tends to be very competitive and that most properties can provide almost the same range of amenities and facilities. However, the truly differentiating factor between a good property and a truly exceptional one lies in its staff. It is in this area that the hotel truly made a lasting impression on me and that is why it is considered among the top properties in this site. Both Ekrem and Yusuf took the time to sit down with me and upon learning that this was my first visit to Istanbul, they offered me tips and advice about where to go, eat and shop. It was contagious to witness the enthusiasm that they displayed in taking pride of their city and how they wanted to share this knowledge with the guests, like a host entertaining friends on a visit. Needless to say, the information that I received from a local perspective proved to be invaluable and this was instrumental in my enjoyment of the city. On my last day, I was hoping that a cancellation would allow me to stay at the Basileus but unfortunately that did not materialize. However, Yusuf booked me at another property a few meters away at a "special" lower price and asked one of the staff members to accompany me there. He invited me to stop by later for some chat and tea which I appreciated. For those coming to Istanbul, if you need to make a call cheaply upon arrival, just go to the post office on the arrival level and use the private telephone there. They charge 0.50 turkish lira for the call which is quite cheap. If you are in the Sultanahmet area and need to go back to the airport, there is a shuttle service that charges 5 EUR per person and pick up you from certain hotels in the area. Inquire at your hotel to see if this service is provided. I found it quick and quite affordable. The Basileus is truly an exceptional hotel and I really enjoyed my stay there. During my travels I tend to stay at different properties and sometimes luxury ones, although pretty comfortable and efficient, sometimes lack a human touch that makes all the difference. The staff and the owner of the Basileus are in a 5 stars category in my book and I will choose them over all other hotels the next time that I go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: 8achan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights, and we had a wonderful stay at this small hotel in Old Sultanahmet in Istanbul. We were able to walk to Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. All the tourist attraction sites were accessible by foot from this hotel. The hotel owners were very friendly and helpful. We arranged a pick up shuttle from the hotel from the Ataturk Airport. Once we arrived at the hotel, they greeted us and showed us all the attraction sites on the map. The breakfast was included, and there was a great selection and variety of food in the morning. We ate delicious omelette in the morning. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel, and we paid a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “`A personal hotel with exceptional service`”
Reviews.Author: Gwyneth006_8
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Istanbul and we were not without some trepadation, however, we need not have worried, this city was without doubt one of the most exciting, cultural and hospitable places we have ever visited. The Basileus Hotel was the perfect base for us. Its location was very near the Blue Mosque and Aghia Sophia. Upon arrival, we were treated like long lost friends with offers of refreshments. Our room was traditional, spotlessly clean and contained everything we needed including a free room safe. We could`nt wait to start to explore this amazing city and as soon as we could we were ready to go. The gentleman on reception was extremely helpful and give guidance on the best places to see day by day. He split the city up into zones and advised us on opening times for main sites, restaurants, and points of interest. Istanbul is not easy to navigate and this help and advice was invaluable. We stayed at this hoted for 4 nights, we received maid service everyday, the breakfast was very good and exceeded our expectations considering the price we paid for the hotel. Every morning we were greeted with cheerfulness and help. Every evening we returned we were offered refreshments and encouraged to share our experiences and events of the day. It was a real home from home. We encountered three gentlemen on reception and each one was very helpful, friendly and informative. I would definately recommend this hotel for the traveller that is looking for a clean and friendly base in which to explore this wonderful city without breaking the bank. Thanks to all the staff at the Basileus who made our holiday truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: OttoPDX
Reviews.Content: The first thing to mention about this hotel is the amazing staff - Yusuf and Ekrem and Co. These guys were extremely helpful in providing detailed information to me via emails as far as airport transfers, hotel details and arranging tours for us were concerned. We felt welcomed from the second we checked in.The check in itself was very quick. Yusuf spent sufficient time with us to recommend some good things to do and nice restaurants to visit. He also gave us a good idea on the lay of the land. The hotel has a pretty decent breakfast and has coffee, tea and water on the house for its guests. The location of the hotel is very good (~5-10 minutes walk from the Hippodrome/the Blue Mosque). The rooms are not bad, but nothing exceptional to write home about. It is entirely possible to get similar location and room with breakfast package for a cheaper rate at other hotels, but the one thing that makes this hotel special is the staff. I will come back to this hotel just for the staff in a heartbeat,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vak88
Reviews.Content: Good location in the old district of Istanbul - about a 10-15 minute walk to the grand bazaar. Wonderfully furnished, very tasteful. Large room with 3 single beds and plenty of walking space. Very clean and also spacious bathroom too. Staff was very helpful, friendly, and patient. Although we were in a hurry out early in the morning for our flight, we grabbed a bit of the breakfast which was quite large and looked absolutely delicious. Good price too for the season. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer60661
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Every evening we would check in with Yusuf who would help us plan our itinerary for the next day - including restaurant recommendations and maps. He was so helpful and his recommendations were spot on. This hotel felt like home. At the end of a long day we would sit in the lobby, drink tea, and hang out with everyone coming in and out. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque. Breakfast every morning was delicious! It was a nice mix of local cuisine and tourist's food. I plan to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: helen07Plano
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfectly placed. 10 mins walk from the tram, The Blue Mosque and other main attractions. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Must be best value in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: insearchofit
Reviews.Content: All the excellent reviews are correct. Had 7 nights there. Nothing was too much trouble. We arrived at 7.30 AM - Room was ready and an extra breakfast not charged for. Has been converted to a hotel about 2 years ago - and room and bathroom high quality and as new. Wifi worked well. Why bother staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Like being with Family”
Reviews.Author: chefinchitown
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler and needed to find a hotel to stay at in Istanbul. Needless to say there was may places to choose from. I came to this site and I started researching. I tripped onto this hotel and after reading all the reviews I decided to stay here. I was a little apprehensive because I was traveling alone and it was smaller then I would normally choose. First they were extremely prompt in answering my emails. Not all the hotels were. Then they arranged for pickup at the airport making my transfer seemless. I got to the hotel exhausted and the first thing they did was offer me coffee or tea. They put me into a lovely single room and I was very comfortable. After a pleasant evening sleeping in my comfortable room i had a great breakfast. After that needed help deciding what to do for the days that I was there. Musharem and Yusuf were so helpful. They had a miliion suggestions of where to go and what to do. They also came up with ideas of great places to eat. needless to say I followed there suggestions and in 4 days I managed to see, eat, and enjoy many pars of Istanbul. I have travelled the world and I have never felt as comfortable as I did at this charming spot. I will be back. For all travelers wanting to find a place in Istanbul this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: GlyderFawr
Reviews.Content: Staff, especially Yossuf are very helpful and friendly. They want you to enjoy your stay, holiday and Turkey. They will answer all questions honestly provide you with information you didn't know you needed, but you do. The room had just been redone and was very clean. Breakfast was great, enough range for you to find something you like and to fill you up for the day. The location is at the bottom of a hill and located close to the Blue Mosque. To be honest I don't think it could have been better located. I recommend this hotel to all. I still give it 5 stars, but you should also know:- The bed was really hard and I like hard beds You can hear the water cisterns filling up in other rooms It can be a little noisy outside for a short while around 11:00 - 12:00 The bath was good, but the shower didn't have any pressure We had booked a suit, but it was more like a room with a bit more floor space and a table and chair.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: OAlvi
Reviews.Content: I booked the Basileus hotel after the amazing reviews on tripadvisor and it was perfect for our 5 day stay in Istanbul. Initially we were four people but that increased to five and the staff was happy to accomodate us even though they were fully booked. We reached Istanbul very early in the morning so by the time we reached the hotel, it was only 7 30. Ekram greeted us and offered us breakfast and coffee. We were famished after a 6 hour flight from Karachi so breakfast and coffee was highly appreciated. After breakfast, Eko told us about the main sights of Istanbul and marked them all on a map. He also saw my things to do list of Istanbul and made me an itinerary. I have been to many hotels and never once has a member of staff helped us so much. Everyday, after we came back from out sightseeing, Yusuf and Muharrem would greet us and ask us how our day went. It was very cold so we would usually come back by 6 or 7 and we would just sit in the lobby and chat with the staff who were so friendly and amicable that we felt like we knew them for years. Yusuf and Mehmit recommended the restaurant Cesme which is right in front of the hotel and it was reasonable and had very good food. My friend (who was travelling with my family) and I used to sit in the lobby at night and talk to Omar who was usually on night duty (we miss you Omar and sorry for bugging you with questions all the time:)). Once, my iphone charger just stopped working and Muharrem gave me his for 2 nights in a row. The hotel is located a 5 minute was away from the main Sultanahmet district where you can find the Blue mosque and Ayasofya. The topkapi palace is a 5 to 10 minute walk away from the Ayasofya. The grand bazaar is also a 7 minute walk away from the hotel which makes it a prime location. Mind you, Istanbul is a slopey city so be prepared to walk uphill. A LOT. The street where the hotel is located has many shops and even a hammam for those interested. The rooms in the hotel are clean and cosy. The bathrooms are new with plenty of hot water which is a must for the cold nights of Istanbul. The internet in the hotel was very good and there is a computer in the lobby which everyone can use. We used to to upload pictures and also to stream a football match. The breakfast buffet is vast and delicious with an option of an omelette. Tea and coffee facilities are always available in the lobby. Overall, i would have to stay that my stay in Istanbul would never have been this much fun without the Basileus Hotel and its wonderful staff. I find myself missing the lobby conversations we had with Yusuf , Muharrem , Eko , Mehmit and Omar. In the 5 days we were in istanbul you guys were like family. Next time i Go to istambul, Basileus Hotel will be my ONLY choice!

Reviews.Title: “Highest hospitality; grat rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Yultraveler50
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at Basileus charming hotel. Location is great to easily walk to Haga Sofia, and the Blue mosque. The rooms are quaint and we loved breakfast every morning. But, most importantly is the hospitality, kindness and friendliness of the staff. Our greatest thanks to Yussuf who took care of us in every way as if we were family. It made our stay memorable and heartwarming. Truly recommending this hotel for all these priceless reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family (wife & mother) 4 days at the Basileus Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is located in the Sultanahamet area and is pretty close to the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, and Hagia Sofia. It is a small and charming hotel, the room was comfortable, very clean, firm beds, and with good heating (we stayed at the beginning of February with cold weather). Because we stayed more than 3 nights they offered to pick us up at the airport at no additional cost. The amazing breakfast was a very nice surprise, they had turkish specialities, dried fruits, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruits, omelets, and turkish coffee. At the hotel lobby there was always complimentary hot tea, which at winter was almost a blessing. The most wonderful thing is the staff, all of them very kind, and warmest. They were always ready to help you and give you advice about all the activities taken place in town. They offered you coffee or tea while talking to you. In sum this is a highly recommended hotel in the Sultanahamet area, is ten minutes block (uphill) to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Justinian Cistern, and Topkapi Palace, and 15/20 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar. I definitely would return to this hotel, it is a great place to stay in Istanbul at a very decent price and with an amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChasingTravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Istanbul and with the help of the people of this hotel, it won't be the last. The location is great for exploring the Old Town and is within a short walk to the tram to reach the rest of Istanbul. Upon my arrival in the morning they offered me breakfast while I waited for my room, then when I was recovered they sat down with me to educate on what to see and do in Istanbul. The staff was always available and willing to help with any questions. The included breakfast is the best I have ever had, the variety and abundance were fantastic. The room was comfortable and clean, with plenty of room. I highly recommend this hotel whether it is your first trip or fifth trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: PRLCH
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at the Basileus Hotel in January 2012 - sadly not long enough! The hotel is very clean and tastefully furnished, and an excellent location! Close to the major sights and very quiet. We enjoyed the breakfast, and found the airport transfers fantastic, as we were 4 adults travelling together, with a reasonable amount of luggage. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, efficient and helpful!! As we only had 24 hours in Istanbul we really appreciated the time they took to suggest what options we had for seeing the sights. Loved the hotel. Loved the location. Excellent value for money. We will be back - next time for a longer visit!

Reviews.Title: “My home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LilaSepang
Reviews.Content: Me and my family (7 of us) stayed in Basileus from 11-17 Feb 2012. And each of us are extremely happy finding this hotel. I do even think one page will not be enough to describe all experience we've had. I did even need to edit my previous review as I thought I missed some points that I must add so everybody will get every information as detail as possible. Here we go: First, They respond to my email very prompt. Since i was taking my mother and parents in law (age range 60-70 and one with wheel chair) with me, I need to ensure everything are planned properly. Ekram and Yusuf always replied to my email right away. Though we are 5 hours different. At early time, they've already making feel at ease. Ive told them that I would bring 3 elderly and they were not able to use stair. And Yusuf and Ekram booked me 2 room in the first floor near the reception area. So this more than easy for my Mom. Second, I didnt need to pay any advance to secure my booking. What I need to do is to give my credit card number. But they didnt charge anything on my card. I think this is reasonable enough to ensure my booking is confirmed. At the end, when I pay cash, I've got 5% discount Third, cannot beat the location!!! especially for the first timer that needs to see the must have site such as blue mosque and hagia sophia. Its literally very close.. its probably only need 3-5 minutes walk depend on the pace. Just watch out that istanbul is an up and down steep hill city. So you need to bring your most comfortable shoes. Moreover, what I love about the location is that its not too loud and its not too quite. Its like living in a decent comfortable neighborhood. Around the hotel, i can find mini market, cake shop that sell turkish delight (so i dont have to go to spice market or grand bazaar), coffee shop, variety of restaurant, meat shop, fruit&vegetable shop, hamam (where you can take turkish bath) and even barber shop. Love love love that area so much Fourth, they serve a great breakfast. This is my favorite time of the day. They serve variety of foods from bread, cheese, eggs, sausages, pancake, french fries, variety of fruits, vegetables, olives, cereal, ham, some nuts, several option of topping sauce, juices, coffee, tea, some turkish delight such as halva (my fave) and cookies. And they will ask you every morning whether you need to have some omelette (it comes with tomato, ham or cheese. or you can mix it all). They will also ask if you want to have a turkish coffee. My mom and sister loves the foods so much they always take long relaxing time during breakfast. Five, facility is more than enough for the value you pay. - The room comes with AC, TV with cable that has more than 100 channels, shower (and bathtub in my room - 206), amenities such as shampoo, soap, shower cap, big and small towels for each person, etc., safety deposit, hanger, free mini bar, wifi with good connection even in the second floor, decent bed (i was actually anticipate a hard bed as I read in couple of review.. but turn out its not hard.. its decent enough for me and my family). - They also provide one computer in the reception area where you can use it any time. Also in the reception area, there is always available hot water along with tea, coffee and sugar. Omer, always guard in the night shift.. so we always felt secure anytime - In the reception area, they provided guide book , travel books, travel magazine that you can read at any time. My father in law loves the reception area, it felt like sitting in the living room at home he said.. Sometime my mom, mother in law and my sister chat in the sofa in the alley with our pijamas... !!! Sixth, they offer a free airport transfer when you arrive, no matter how many groups you are. And they provide 60TL for a big van that fit 7 people (i wrote it wrong in my previous review, its not 60 euro but its 60 turkish lira.. I just want other traveler to get the right info). Seventh, and this is the MOST IMPORTANT ONE.. their HOSPITALITY and SERVICE is superb and unbelievable... let me list it down one by one: - Once we arrived, we are greeted my Muharem.. and he right away explained us on how to get our bearing on the city. He showed us the city map and circled down every must have sites to go and explained us how to go there and the best time to go there. If you have specific interest you can tell them as they wont hesitate to give some advise. For example, my husband has an interest in military and war. Muharem advised us to go to military museum and watch some military concert that happened every day at 3pm. Things like this we would probably not get from regular tour agent - Every time we came back to the hotel.. each of them always ask how was our day.. and we ended up having a nice long chat. I really appreciate this very much, as I've got many information about many things such as life in instanbul in general or even about religion. For example, one day we came back from the whirling dervish dance in Hodja Pasha and I told them I would be more appreciative if I understand the meaning behind. And they right away explained me not only the meaning but also the history behind. I never forgot about this, as this is why I love traveling.. understand people's culture and custom.. thank you everyone to widen my horizon - Prompt assistance when you needed. One day the tour that I booked online (separately not from Basileus) was not as we expected. So I must stop the rest of it for the sake of my Mom's health. I turned to Omar and wonder if he can get me a van to rent for one day so we can relaxly go around the city by ourself. It was last minute request actually, requested a night before. Without any fuss, Omer booked us a car. And some other day, I did even worse.. I asked Omer to rent another car again.. I requested in the morning to be available 3 hours after. Amazingly, the car is available without a fuss. Thank you Omer for this (both my mothers were so in love with him btw=). We also asked them if they can help us to find a decent bosporus tour (also last minute request) that has a slow pace that will be managable for my mom (who has trouble walking). Muharem and Yusuf had a discussion with us about this and list down what sites that weve been to and what site that we havent been to. And they suggest me the most efficient tour that fit the time, money and my mom disability. They told me in detail which one is worth to go which one not - Every time we need information about eating they will always provide you with one. They can even help us deliver some food from the resto in front of the hotel. Its literally delivered to our room - The hotel has no stair.. so if you have many bags they will help you to take it to your room. - The room always spotlessly clean when we arrived.. I thank the cleaning ladies there.. they are literally cleaning every corner... !!! - As an indonesian, we always eat hot spicy food. So, whenever traveling, we always bring our own hot chilly sauce. Based on our past experience, we rarely found any chilly sauce provided in other B&B or hotel. Surprisingly, on the 3rd day, we found a big bottle of chilly sauce provided during breakfast. OMG!!! my husband was so happy as we almost ran out of chilly sauce. This little things such this is the reason why we fell in love with this hotel.. - The last one is for me an evidence where they want to do extra mile to have your stay comfortable. One day, my mom had an idea to cook Indonesian food. So we asked them to lend us their kitchen. And they had us using their kitchen helped by mr Asref. We ended up sharing the foods with them and had a conversation about how to cook it. So to sum up.. (since I can go on and on talking about the good things on Basileus), staying in Basileus is like staying in our home for me and my family. Its where we felt at welcomed after a tiring day, relax and at ease knowing that everything is at their service and the most importantly its where we felt the greatest turkish warmth that I've never experienced in other place before. Its a feeling that you're always being taken care, just like your own family or friends take care of you... Hence, if you want to get the depth of Istanbul.. its people, its custom and its culture... this is the place to stay... For everybody in Basileus: Yusuf, Muharem, Omer, Ekram, Fatih, Eko, Asref and the cleaning ladies... Marvelous job.. Best regards from my family... up till now, they are still talking about you...

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest and best located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChloeMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Basileus Hotel. They arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport, provided us with tons of information for touring the city. The hotel is impeccably clean. The staff is more than helpful, greeting us and chatting over a cup of tea when we returned form our visits. The hotel is very well located, close to all major sites, in a safe area, and across a small and delightful restaurant (great for local dishes after a long bay/inexpensive). A nice note: try the apricot preserves at breakfast..... a delight followed by a cup of Turkish coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNKLB
Reviews.Content: Prompt communication with the hotel prior to arrival. Good website to check out too. Location = central for Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia & public transport. Approximately a 5 minute walk. Great first impression from day 1. Hotel looks great from the outside. Rooms are spacious.clean with excellent facilities i.e safe, fridge, TV, heater/air con & hairdryer. Rooms are cleaned daily to an exceptional standard. Spoilt for choice at breakfast. Free wifi is an added bonus -works well. Lastly, the staff were lovely, knowledgeable, helpful, attentive & very welcoming. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul. We'll be back! A must.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BojanK131
Reviews.Content: This hotel will raise the bar when it comes to any future accomodation you stay in. Not only is it inexpensive but its service is second to none. Free wifi and mini bar (let's see if the chain hotels will pull off the same). You will also experience the hospitality that this great city is famous for. A highly reccommended hotel and will definately be back on any future visits to Istanbul. So please, forget the Four Seasons or Hilton and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Convienient Choice”
Reviews.Author: hmurch
Reviews.Content: The Basileus Hotel is a well-maintained compact hotel located within easy 10-minute walk of major visitor sites; Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia, etc. If you stay three nights, free airport pickup is included. The hotel staff provides the very best personalized service and will eagerly point out visiting options and restaurants. Lobby has public computer available for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “More than a bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 186RalphB
Reviews.Content: Before I came to Istanbul, I thought hotels had a goal to openly rip you off. Basileus Hotel was the exact opposite, they were more interested in our own satisfaction and enjoyment of the trip than selling us anything. Every day Youssef, Muharrem or Eko would ask us our plans and advised us many places to go that could give us the better side of Istanbul. It was truly an enjoyable hotel experience where our relation to the hotel was extremely personal and made us feel at home. In addition, the location is in the heart of Istanbul's sight seing , I would recommend anyone going to Istanbul to try it

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and people! Would recommend to anyone!!”
Reviews.Author: hoodafa
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Basileus last week, and I have nothing but good things to say about our stay. The hotel and rooms were clean, the location is excellent (walking distance to several major monuments, the enchanting - if a tad overpriced - Arasta Bazaar, and a 5-7-minute walk to the metro) and the breakfast spread was both extensive and sumptuous. (With free breakfast and airport pick-up - three-night minimum - the rooms are definitely worth the money!) What sets apart this hotel from others, however, is the attitude of the staff. Each and every one of them was happy to help, and eager to make sure our stay was as comfortable as possible - be it the guy who carried our four (rather heavy suitcases) to (and from) our room on the second floor multiple times, the chef who accommodated two requests to serve breakfast earlier than their normal time (a full hour early in one instance), or the gentlemen who staff the front desk. Everyone was warm, courteous, friendly, and above all, transparent and honest in their dealings. Another thing worth mentioning is that the airport transfer company they work with is super-punctual and has very reasonable rates. On arrival into the country, not only was our flight a couple of hours late, but it also took us inordinately long to clear immigration...but there they were with our name on a placard, and uttered not a single word of complaint about the wait they had to endure because of the delay.

Reviews.Title: “wow! what a find!”
Reviews.Author: fionadenmead049
Reviews.Content: I don't think we have ever had a nicer hotel experience than the one we have just had at the Basileus Hotel. This was largely due to the kindness and friendship shown to us by Yusuf, Muharrem, Eko, Mehmet and Omer, who were the best hosts we could possibly have had. One of them was always there to give us tea (most welcome given that we spent our Istanbul week in the coldest weather for 25 years!) when we came in from the cold, and lots of helpful advice on where to eat, where to have a Turkish bath and places to visit. Our room was warm and comfortable and they immediately supplied us with brighter reading lights and a smaller pillow when we asked. The breakfast was very, very delicious and our room was beautifully cleaned each day. I think we will be returning to Istanbul and a large reason for this will be to revisit this lovely hotel and the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly”
Reviews.Author: snorbens64
Reviews.Content: The people at the hotel were very friendly, you felt really to be a guest in the true sense. The Hotel is very close to the centre but on a quite back street. Booking direct with the hotel saves 20 euro on the transfer if you are staying for 4 nights..

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary ambience”
Reviews.Author: lidiafw
Reviews.Content: the hotel - perfectly located, warm and cosy, clean and fragrant, nicely furnished and offering all the tiny things which may come in handy for a traveller, such as a room safe, slippers, 24-hour tea facilities ;-); a rich choice of tasty breakfast food, and above all - a really special ambience created by all the staff - attentive and tactful, knowledgeable and ready to offer guidance, cheerful and witty...

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, friendly hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Karsrim
Reviews.Content: The first thing that needs mentioning about this hotel is the staff. Each and every one of them are very friendly and very keen to help. We arrived past midnight on the first day. We were given a room in the ground floor. We requested a room in the second or third floor. All we had to do was pack and leave the things before we set off. When we came back, all our stuff was moved to the third floor. The staff ask you about the number of days that you have to spend and they draw up a personalise tour plan to cover most of the places that you can in the time that you have. they recommended two restaurants for us and both were really good. The location of the hotel is perfect - it is in walk able distance to the blue mosque, grand bazar and topikapi palace and also the tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Simon307
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this cosy and clean hotel with its welcoming, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable hosts. The hotel is situated close to the Blue Mosque and the tram station Sultanahmet (5 minutes walk). We appreciated the hosts' tips for navigating the city and their recommendations regarding restaurants. We would definitely stay here again should we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktraveler81
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a long weekend and we had a great experience. The location is quite good and the staff are wonderful. Breakfast is filling and the rooms are comfy. I really can't say anything bad about staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, convenient location, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: CostumeDesigner1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a colleague, three graduate students, and me. Our rooms were quiet, pleasantly furnished, spectacularly clean, and had reliable wi-fi access. Yusef, Eko, Omar and Muharrem were always friendly and helpful with advice on any subject. They offered maps, transportation methods and routes. They knew excellent places to eat and where to buy the best Turkish Delight. Breakfast was a delicious buffet that included Western and Turkish breakfast staples and omelets made to order. Evening chats with the hotel staff after long work days or days of exploring Istanbul's many attractions were pleasant and illuminating. All of us will happily return to the Basileus on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jampotannie
Reviews.Content: Basileus Hotel Istanbul Dec 4-7 & 24-26, 2011 Stayed twice at the Basileus - upon my arrival and before my departure 3 weeks later Dec 24-26th. One of the friendliest hotels throughout my travels across Turkey, where the staff genuinely go out of their way to ensure guest enjoy not only Istanbul, but also their country. As a single traveller, my priorities are always safety, location, cleanliness and good food! - Basileus excelled in all. Friendliness and helpfulness of staff is a bonus. The hotel shined on all points! I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d have had as much fun exploring the outer city locations, using local transport, without Ekoâ€™s kind assistance. Since I got lost more times! Returning later than expected one evening, the owner tried to reach me to make sure I was okay. Not too many hotels boast such care. The hotel is still in the midst of finishing and retouching various rooms, reception and breakfast areas, all of which are completely usable, and once completed, further add to the overall appearance and quality of guests experience. The rooms are of varying sizes, some not quite so stark, again a work in progress. Each room I stayed in was functional and very clean. The location is within easy walking distance to all relevant tourist attractions, streetcars and markets. Breakfast is good. Lots of dried fruits, cheeses, olives, bread, omelettes and fresh coffee each morning, plus Turkish coffee. The hotel is easily accessed from the airport by taxi or local metro/streetcar routes. But as with smaller hotels, I would ask the hotel to forward either a detailed map or written instructions, in the native language, to hand the cab driver, if in doubt. I travelled by local transportation everywhere, never had a problem having a native speaker write the instructions. Okay, I got lost a few times! But thatâ€™s the fun of exploring â€“ right. Some reviewers mentioned problem finding the Basileus Hotel, in which case, Iâ€™d simply email the hotel before arrival for specific details if you havenâ€™t arranged for the hotelâ€™s airport pick-up service. Just like to add a â€˜special thank youâ€™ again, to Eko, the owners, and staff at Basileus Hotel for all their kindness throughout my stay - Miss our chats & Apple tea guys, or was that apple tea and chats! :)

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommended”
Reviews.Author: ozzie5melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our return to the city. This was a great hotel with the best breakfast we had in Turkey. We paid 50 E for a twin room through www.booking.com which was clean and had a good bathroom. The staff was excellent with very good English and they offered good advice. We definitely recommend this hotel and suggest you try contacting the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaelF0000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Basileus last week and we couldn't be happier. It's a quite new looking hotel with very good features. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DowntownWorld
Reviews.Content: Full service hotel with a big, clean and comfortable room. Excellent location within walking distance of the sights. The front desk staff is extremely helpful and friendly and the breakfast is amazing. Would definitely stay here again. We booked transport to and from the airport, which definitely made our visit smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, OK room”
Reviews.Author: foxallis
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Basileus are beyond compare. We felt so welcomed and they helped us with recommendations for restaurants and things to do. Yusef even gave us a spare tram token of his after he explained how to utilize public transportation! The room was clean and bright, but we asked for a quiet room in the back, and upon arrival, were told that while they tried, they could not provide us with one. The street noise was considerably loud and we both had difficulty sleeping as a result of it. Also, the bed was too firm, and I usually prefer firm beds. The breakfast was very good - freshly made omelets and lots of fresh produce at the buffet. The location was also excellent. Overall, a very good stay because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: gchatziar
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for four nights. Very helpfull(Yusuf, Ekrem and rest of them), excellent situation(you can visit all main attractions on foot,or by tram),daily cleaning, free wi-fi,decent breakfast. Two stores building, no elevator(no problem at all). Individual aircon, safe, hairdryer ,frige with complimentary soft drinks. If you can, DON'T use taxi in Istanbul,unless called by the hotel's reception. Total scam, every time we used one the driver tried to charge double or triple. Don't trust what the taximeter tells. Your route probably costs 50% less!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Blzerdude
Reviews.Content: Basileus sits in a very central location in the Old Town of Istanbul within easy walking distance or a quick tram ride to all major attractions. I found the staff to be incredibly helpful and courteous during my stay. As a solo traveler, I appreciated their hints and tips for navigating the city and their recommendations. The staff went out of their way to make my time at their hotel very enjoyable. The rooms are generally well-decorated and are quite satisfactory. The breakfast offered several choices and was very appetizing. I actually got quite sick during my stay (not the fault of the hotel), but the staff was accommodating regardless! The airport transfer offered was also a very good deal. Overall, I would definitely stay here again should I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “While not amazing, it's just fine”
Reviews.Author: Ianfi
Reviews.Content: Basileus is a perfectly decent hotel in the heart of Istanbul's tourist district. It's a good value and the staff is extremely kind. The rooms are spacious if a bit spartan, the breakfast buffet is decent, and they offer nice touches like a complimentary mini bar stocked with water and soft drinks. But ultimately, the hotel left me feeling empty. While the staff was very eager to please, the lobby felt like a hangout area for the staff's friends and family. The breakfast buffet was only passable, and was tucked away in the basement. And the bed was just plain uncomfortable. I wouldn't say that Basileus is a "bad" hotel or that it should be avoided; it's a perfectly good budget option. But unlike our first hotel in Istanbul, Basileus didn't impress us. It reminded me of any number of other nondescript budget hotels/ pensions around Europe. Acceptable and eager to please, but just okay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience! A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ApoorvaCheruku
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Basileus for at the beginning and the end of our trip to Turkey and it really felt like we were staying at home. The hotel is in a quiet street and has an amazing amazing location. Its 10-15 min walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi , Aya Sophia, and also the tram station, grand bazaar. They arranged for airport pickup in a huge SUV for just two of us! The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was elaborate with bread, preserves, fruits, cereal, oats, eggs, cold cuts, olives , cheese, turkish coffee and so much more. The staff at Basileus are very gracious, eager to assist and go out of their way to help their guests. I want to say a special thank you to Eko and Yusuf. They were so very helpful with sightseeing, local sim cards (Eko actually got us a mobile sim on his name since its more cheaper that way), about restaurants (their recommendations were excellent), and shopping. They told us about these great places where you can pick up the best Baklava and Turkish delight to take back home. Overall Basileus was our favourite in all the hotels we stayed in Turkey. And it is also fantastic for women travellers. Thank you Basileus for making our stay in Istanbul memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all attractions and exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: j t
Reviews.Content: This hotel comes recommended by Trip Advisor reviewers for good reasons. Situated conveniently, the small three star has a friendly staff eager to assist in identifying things to do in Istanbul (though a bit too interested in set tours and the restaurant owned by a relative). An amusingly diverse breakfast includes an individually made omelet if desired, and sweet cookies, olives, herbed feta, breads, fruits and coffee (Turkish if you want), as well as the ubiquitous tea.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its finest”
Reviews.Author: googly69
Reviews.Content: The Basileus is a fairly new hotel located about a quarter mile from The Blue Mosque, tucked away in the quaint alleys of Sultanahmet. I had booked a single room with a double bed. The hotel arranged for a pickup from the hotel for a small fee. Upon check-in, I was immediately put at ease by Ekrem, who offered me coffee and tea. He then showed me to my room and asked me to swing by after I've had a chance to relax, and he would share information about exploring magnificent Istanbul. He shared all the restaurants, the ones the locals eat at. He also warned me of the local tourist scams to be wary of and more importantly he asked me to enjoy the local sights and sounds by keeping an open mind. I'm a seasoned traveler, and the most exciting aspect of travel is to taking on a local avatar and let the city be the guide. My four days in Istanbul went by too fast, and did not disappoint. Yusuf, the manager is a truly wonderful guy. He and I conversed about the local customs and the variety of people he's had a chance to meet and befriend over the years. He treated me to lunch at a local restaurant which served some of the best grilled anchovies I've had a chance to taste. After that we talked about the economic and political issues of today's world over piping hot cups of tea and strong Turkish coffee. Folks, if you want glitzy furnished rooms, there a many hotels in Istanbul that will gladly take your money. However, if you truly want a 5 Star experience, stay at the Basileus. The folks working here are the finest ambassadors of Turkish culture. They put your comfort and well being first. The rooms are fantastic, cozy and extremely comfortable. The breakfast (with omelettes on request) is quite a spread and will keep you fueled for the day out in Istanbul. Top that off with a staff that caters to your every wish and demand..after my first few hours in my room, I mentioned to them in passing that it was a bit small. Yusuf immediately offered to upgrade me to a larger suite at no cost. Now that is what I call service! After the first night I told him that my room grew on me and I'm fine where I was. That did not deter them from asking me for the next couple of days about shifting to the superior room. The Basileus has consistently high reviews for one thing, it's customer service, with a personal touch. You come away from this place wanting more. I have found my home away from home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very helpful and hospitable staffs, delicious breakfast and valuable room rate”
Reviews.Author: Saber B
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful especially Mr. Akram. They advise you about tourist attractions, about restaurants, where you can do some shopping.The accommodations were very comfortable and clean with nice sized rooms.The breakfast was tasteful and had a nice variety and was included in the price. Location was outstanding, close to all tourist attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruce144
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The location is fantastic, just a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, but the location is also quiet considering you are in the centre of a city. Ekram (Eko) on reception cannot be faulted, he was friendly and welcoming and full of information about how to get the best from your time in Istanbul. The breakfast exceeded our expections, great choice of cold food with omlettes made on demand with a filling of your choice. I would also recommend the use of the transfer facility from the airport, 20 Euros from Ataturk Airport to the hotel for both of us, we were whisked in luxury straight to the hotel, which was even more appreciated when we saw how busy the trams were! Thanks Eko.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and very Welcoming! From FEZ (Preston UK)”
Reviews.Author: Fez D
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Basileus hotel in Istanbul for 7 nights and it was one of the best holidays we have ever had and the hotel service with the perfect location made it superb. The rooms were very clean in the hotel, the breakfast was great and a mini fridge was also provided in the room which was fully stocked by the hotel everyday. It rained for a day or two and the hotel provided us with umbrellas. The staff were very friendly, helpful and willing to go out of their way. They sorted our Bospherous cruise trip and gave us excellent information about the great Istanbul. They sorted wi-fi for my mobile phone and they treated us like family. I would definitely go to this hotel again and strongly recommend this superb hotel. The trip to Istanbul was superb but with the additional bonus of the hotel and its service, it was made extra superb. Basileus hotel is the place to stay whilst you explore the capital of the world Istanbul. I will definitely go there again. Thanks again lads!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We have new true friends in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Lealsi
Reviews.Content: My fresh husband and I decided to spend honeymoon in Istanbul, and thank God we chose Basileus! I never felt so welcome in a hotel. It's like entering your own home. From the entrence where you always meet staff with smiles till you go to bed (they have really nice orthopedic matresses), you feel comfortable and welcome. Muharrem and Mehmet are really two wonderful persons, so enthusiastic and hard working, they inspired us! Yusuf, Eko and other staff are so kind, helpful and always in a good mood. So, for staff, if the max grade is 10, we'll give them 15! :) Besides staff and service, the hotel has excellent location, cleanliness and breakfast. It's about 2 minutes from Hippodrom and other points of interest in Sultahmet. If I can recommend a hotel in Istanbul for a honeymoon, it would definately be Basileus. THANK YOU GUYS! L&H

Reviews.Title: “Clean and beautiful rooms, terrific service”
Reviews.Author: hencjo
Reviews.Content: I had a one-night layover in Istanbul and arrived to Baselius hotel at night and left early next morning. Despite the late hour the man in the reception took his time to explain everything, point out nearby bars, ATMs, sights, arrange airport transfer, and tips on how to stay safe in Istanbul. Rooms were clean and pretty. Bathrooms especially good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service staff!”
Reviews.Author: tempestblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights @85 euros a night in early Nov 11. Excellent service by Yusuf, who welcomed us warmly when we arrived, gave us complimentary coffees, gave us extensive advice on where to visit and eat in Istanbul, exchanged Lira with us above the standard money exchange rates :), and even arranged for a packed breakfast for us at 5am in the morning when we had to depart early. Rooms are clean, sheets are spotless, and the location is great too. 5-10 mins walk to the Blue Mosque. Cons? The bed is a little on the hard side. :p I can't think of anything else i could be dissatisfied about.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Beyond Belief and Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: AndyDraven
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Besileus Hotel based upon the reviews posted on Trip Advisor. Everything that is stated here is current and accurate. The hotel is run by individuals who appear to be all family and/or related somehow. Immediately, upon arrival, they treat you as if you are part of their family. They welcome you warmly and heartedly and help you with every step of your stay with them. What is great about the staff of the Basileus Hotel is that they take the time to get to know you and your likes and make recommendations based upon what they get to know of you. They are honest, up front and extremely hospitable. There is not enough praise that can be given to each and every one of the individuals who run the Basileus Hotel. My flight arrived early and I arrived early. With no rooms available until 12 p.m. the next day, the staff at the Basileus Hotel took it upon their self to contact a neighboring hotel to find out of there was a room available for the night. Amazing service right from the get go! From the front desk to the cleaning staff to the well dressed manager during breakfast, every single one of the employees of the Basileus Hotel treat you with respect and as if you were family. There are many hotels in the area, many larger chain hotels such as Best Western, Crowne Plaza, etc. but NONE of these hotels had their guests in the lobby. These hotels seemed like a ghost town. But yet, the Basileus was alive. The hotel itself is 10 - 15 minute walking distance to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia. In addition, it is about 15 - 20 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. It is a great location if you like to explore the city on foot. I would choose to stay at the Basileus Hotel in a heartbeat. Please feel free to contact me to ask any questions based upon this review.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and safe”
Reviews.Author: Elspeth L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Basileus my first 3 nights in Istanbul on my first trip oversees by myself. It was the perfect choice. I felt safe, welcome and nothing was too much trouble to the warm and friendly staff. The recommended good restaurants, they provided me with someone to chat to about my day when I came home, they told me about the history of Turkey and recommended places to go and sights to see. Incredibly warm Turkish hospitality and an excellent breakfast. While incredibly central it is on the less touristy side of the Blue Mosque so you spend less time dealing with carpet sellers and other hawkers. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Happiness in Basilius Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wimon-A
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, helpful staffs, quiet room, delicious breakfast and good restaurant for dinner nearby will bring you happiness in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: KDDFairbanks_Alaska
Reviews.Content: My brother and I recently shared a room at the Basileus for 3 nights. I cannot say enough about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Eko (Ekram) and Yusuf, made you feel like family and would spend as much time as you wanted going over places to see etc. The entire staff was excellent: Amer, Muharrem, Fatih and Roza. The room was clean and tastefully furnished. Because we had 2 twins, it felt of average size, but with a single bed it would have felt bigger. The bathroom was very nice, clean and very modern. The breakfast was superb, complete with anything you could have asked for, including omlettes made to your liking. I was partial to the wonderful yogurt, honey and fresh tasting nuts. The location was excellent, within a short walk of the Blue Mosque. We had been warned by a friend that the beds were very firm, but we found them comfortable. I would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat and recommend it to my friends and family. They provided transportation from the airport, and although it took us a little while to find the right transportation, it was provided complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel, great location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneGrecophile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent eight glorious days in exotic and fasinating Istanbul. Although the weather was cold, gray and raining most of the time, the warmth we experienced at the delightful Hotel Basileus in Old Town Istanbul (Sultanahmet) more than made up for that. What a perfect hotel. Small and welcoming. Our room was clean, quiet and very comfortable. There is no elevator, but the wonderful staff graciously carried our heavy bags to our room upon arrival and departure. We were given excellent guidance by the very helpful and knowledgeable men at the reception desk, as to what route to take when walking in order to maximize our time there. All their suggestions concerning restaurants, sights and routes proved to be excellent. Breakfast was beyond compare with delicious Turkish and European foods presented in a fabulous buffet. Every morning, when we had filled our plates with every imaginable delight, we were offered omelets or soft-boiled eggs in addition - cooked to order by Fatih or Omer. Turkish coffee was offered as a perfect end to the meal. Upon our arrival, or whenever we returned from a long day of walking, we were offered complimentary tea or coffee. (Apple tea is a wonderful discovery!) We were made to feel as though we were in our own home and that Yusuf and Eko and all the other wonderful staff were our family. We felt genuine sadness upon leaving. The staff is warm, friendly and welcoming and may not realize how much their kindness means to us travelers, but we want to thank them. We know we are just two of many people they meet each day, but the Hotel Basileus and its wonderful staff made us feel very special and is an integral part of our Istanbul experience. We will always think of it and the friends we made there when we think of Istanbul. We cannot recommend this gem of a hotel highly enough and will always return to the Hotel Basileus on any future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Service”
Reviews.Author: heyman747
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of a friend's recommendation. His comment was that the beds were on the firm side and the rooms were small, but the service provided by a helpful staff, the location, and the breakfast made it worth it. Well, I enjoyed the bed, and found that the other features exceeded my expectations. Yes, this is a budget hotel, not a 5 star resort, but the staff was more friendly and helpful than any Hyatt or Oberoi that I have experienced. Yusuf, Eko and the others made you feel like a member of their family, not just a guest in their hotel. If I had a budget for a more expensive hotel on my next visit to Istanbul, I would still return to the Baileus.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul was great; Basileus Hotel was amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dipmono
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many wonderful, highly rated, hotels in my life. From 5 star hotels on the beach; to Bed and Breakfast Inns, whose goal is to make you feel like you have never left home. The Basileus is able to give you all of the comforts of both of these type of hotels, but also make you feel like you are part of their family; which for me, is priceless! I originally decided to stay at the Basileus because of the amazing reviews that it received on Tripadvisor. In addition, I didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for my stay in Istanbul. So when I first arrived at the hotel, I a little anxious not knowing what to expect. I was greeted at the door with a hot cup of tea and a smile. But I guess that I should have expected this hospitality given the friendliness that Muharrim conveyed on the phone when I called to confirm my reservation. I was worried that the hotel would not allow me to check in early given that my flight was due to arrive at 8:00 am. But to my surprise, Muharrim said " dont worry, you can checkin anytime you want." The staff at are truly friendly and accommodating. Yusuf, Ekrem, and Muharrim are outstanding people and are there to take all the stress out of your travel. They are knowledgeable about Turkey and truly care about the experiences of their guests at the hotel. The hotel itself is very close to Blue Mosque and most of the top tourist sites in Istanbul. I personally think that you can get anywhere within the city limits of Istanbul within 20 minutes from the hotel. The rooms at the hotel are great; good size, clean, and noise-free. Free breakfast is always good, but breakfast at the Basileus was even better. In addition to every fruit that you can imagine, we were treated to Turkish coffee, tea, fresh juices, and our choice of ready to order omelets. My stay in Istanbul was great, but the Basielus made my experience unforgettable. When I return to Istanbul in the future, I know that there is only one hotel for me......The Basileus !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over night in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: podsRI
Reviews.Content: Hi, just got back from cruise in Med. Stayed at Basileus Hotel on an overnight in Istanbul. The hotel was close to all the sites. The staff was excellant and very helpful. No elevator but no question on handling our bags up the stairs to our room. The room was clean and quite (in the back).Breakfast was free and very good. Free transportation to the cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Turkey.”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: Now the UK winter's coming on we're looking back on the travel highlights of the year and most memorable is our first trip to Turkey in May. This was made particularly memorable by the luck we had in selecting the Basileus Hotel as our base. On arrival we were offered a seat and a cup of tea while we registered, offered advice and information matching our interests and then shown to a clean and comfortable room where we spent the next 9 nights. The staff were smiling and friendly, the breakfasts excellent and the service and support as good as we've experienced anywhere in the world. The hotel is situated in Sultamahmet, 5 minutes from the Bospherus shore in one direction and 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque in the other. A walk up the hill past the Blue Mosque puts you on the tram line within easy reach of all the main attractions. There are several restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel plus corner shops, a bakery, a Thursday fruit and veg street market and a Turkish bath house. The restaurant opposite the hotel is particularly good and modestly priced. The proximity of several mosques means that sleep can be interrupted by the Imams' calls early in the morning but we enjoyed that, and where in Istanbul can you not hear the call to prayer? We got a good deal on our extended stay but the prices are generally in the mid range and certainly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: iannsa
Reviews.Content: i've stayed in too many hotels to mention, and Basileus is without doubt the best of all. i chose the hotel because of other Tripadvisor reviews, and it was the right choice. the friendliness was evident from the first email enquiry i made, and the guys at the hotel: Yusuf, Ekrem, Muharrim and all the others, were just outstanding. they were always helpful, always ready to give the best advice about where to go, how to get there etc. These guys were just fantastic. The other guests i met during my stay, also shared this view, and were also very friendly. The hotel itself is very close to Blue Mosque and most of the top tourist sites in Istanbul. The room was ideal for me, and the breakfast here was also fantastic. this hotel is highly recommended - and i just hope they can accommodate me when i visit Istanbul again !!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: Travelinwkids14
Reviews.Content: Sensational sums it up. We had a family room which was perfect for the 4 of us (2 boys aged 9 and 11) and stayed for 3 nights in October. Very very clean, comfy and enough room for us. The staff were amazing and always ready with great ideas. Everyone was so friendly. Breakfast was wonderful and the omelettes the best ever. We walked everywhere. If only we'd had more time here - will just have to go back. Lovely little deli over the street for late night snacks and beverages. Our taxi driver took a while to find it so suggest maybe printing a google map before you leave home with location to show the driver. If travelling with kids suggest the 1.5hr turyol cruise rather than the longer one - sit on the starboard side - a good deal at 12 TL.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: laineymcdublin
Reviews.Content: Hi, Couldn't recommend this hotel enough. The guys were so helpful and patient - showing everyone maps, offering advise and what to do and where to go. I arrived on an overnight flight and was told to go down and help myself to some breakfast and check in when finished! The rooms were lovely and clean and the hotel had great WiFi. It was a great location a short 10 minute stroll to the old city and all its attractions and loads of lovely restaurants and the tram line also. Breakfast was lovely continental style with a great omelette and a Turkish coffee (to kick start the day). Had a great trip to Istanbul made even better by choosing to stay in this hotel. Thanks guys!! Elaine

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing staff and hotel in beautiful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Deirdre750
Reviews.Content: I read excellent reviews about Basileus Hotel on trip advisor and believe me I was not dissapointed. I stayed there solo for 3 nights and had an amazing experience. The staff , owner Muharram, Yusuf, Eko and the others are the best I have met on all my travels. The hospitality is nothing short of exceptional. Breakfast was awesome with many choices to satisfy everyone. Location is excellent within walking distance to all the top sights. My room was spotless and really comfy. I love this hotel and can't wait to return in the Spring. Special thanks to Muharram for all his assistance during my my quick stay. You made it possible for me to see all the important sights in such a short time. Believe me you will NEVER miss your early morning flight while staying here. Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: billfr
Reviews.Content: Everyone in this hotel was just just great. If you ever know the real meaning and experience of genuine hospitality this place is it. Maybe American hotels should send people here to learn or hire these guys.

Reviews.Title: “Cosiness and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Yaryna K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Basileus Hotel with my friend in the summer. We were good impressed of its cosiness. Everywhere was clean, comfortable and nice decorated. Location of the hotel close to the Blue Mosque, Basilica cistern and other main sightseeing of Istanbul allowed us to feel better atmosphere of this incredible city. We are grateful to the hotel staff for excellent service, their helpfulness, hospitality and benevolence from the first minute of our stay. Great thanks to Yusuf for his support, friendly attitude and useful advices. We definitely recommend the hotel for everyone who is seeking good place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Irena V
Reviews.Content: Just got back from one week stay at Basileus Hotel. It was our first visit to Istanbul and we had a fantastic time. The service was great, perfect location, rooms were fab - very spacious and comfortable and delicious breakfast. I would like to give a special thank you to Yusuf, for making this vacation wonderful, he was so helpful. We would reccommend Basileus Hotel with open hearts and minds. Can't wait to return. Will be back with friends in summer or fall. Irena and Andrew from Toronto, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Being flight attendants, we are used to staying in hotels all over the world, and this has to be one of the best. We booked this hotel at the last minute. From the moment we walked in the door, we were amazed at the genuinely warm welcome by Eko, Yusuf, Muharram and everyone else. They sat us down with cups of tea and answered all our questions before we were shown to our room, which was immaculately clean, quiet and comfortable. The next morning, we had a nice buffet breakfast in the dining room - which we later realised would be the best breakfast we would have while in Turkey. When we left for Cappadocia and Ephesus, they were booked out for our return, but told us to come back and they would help us find a place. Luckily, when we returned, they had a room available for us, and we were welcomed back like family members. Being in the service industry, you realise that the room, bed, and other facilities are important, but it is the people who make a place really special. This small family-run hotel ticks all the boxes, and will be our top recommendation for friends and family who visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: richard f
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Basileus for 7 nights in early November during our first visit to Istanbul. A fairly priced, clean, and well maintained three story property with good size rooms. No restaurant (has breakfast room with good food) or elevator, but well worth the money. Located near all the major sights in Sultanhamet. A 10 minute uphill walk to the, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Basilica Cistern, a small bazaar, tramway, ATMs and money exchanges. A 15-20 minute walk to Grand Bazaar and main shopping streets. Many restaurants within a 5-20 minute walk include Seven Hills (fish restaurant with rooftop dining and outstanding views), Armada (good views of Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and the Bosphorus), Sokullu (warm, cozy neighborhood place), Amedros (outdoor dining, Turkish cuisine), and Cesme (a refuge across street from hotel). A 20 minute taxi ride to Chora church and Asitane restaurant (both well worth the ride) , Spice Bazaar and other sights. Staff is terrific. All speak excellent English and everyone is friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lorin P
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone @ Basileus Hotel, I can't say enough how welcoming and friendly all the staff are..:) We arrived late in the evening from the airport and had no dinner,they arranged a lovely dinner in from restaurant across from Basileus Hotel. We stayed for 6 nights in a very spacious & clean room (free mini fridge). Location was perfect for all major sightseeing also. Me & my husband would like to thank all the lovely staff for looking after us! We enjoyed our honeymoon in Istanbul very much.You are all so kind and full of information.We would love to come & stay @ Basileus Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “When You're Here, You Are Family”
Reviews.Author: Housinglawyer1
Reviews.Content: After a long, tiring flight, Yusuf and Echo (pardon the misspelling) are quick to greet you with a Chai, Turkish coffee, or water. As you begin to recover and get settled in, they and Muharram, the owner, treat you like a long lost friend and they begin to aquaint you with the sites and history of Istanbul that await your exploration. Everyone has great suggestions not only on what to see and how to plan your time, but they have equally good recommendations on restaurants and the best places to buy baklava, helva, and other Turkish delights. As for the hotel itself, it is well situated in the historic district; Tokapai Palace, Ayasofia, the Blue Mosque, the Underground Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, and a tram stop are nearby but be prepared for a decent walk up a moderate hill. The rooms are reasonably sized and very clean and comfortable. Last but not least, the hotel has a great breakfast selection and be prepared for the staff to politely ask you what type of omelet you would like that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for value for money, quality and location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a family room at the Basileus. Although advertised as being in the Sultanahmet, its really just a few streets away in a slightly more run down area. However, this does work in favour, in that it is still amazing close to all the tourists attractions (minutes walk) but if you are on a budget like we were, there are some great really cheap places to eat round the corner, head for the places where the Turks go to. In addition we found that the rates were cheaper than hotels that you would literally find a couple of streets further up the hill. But as mentioned in some of the other reviews it is on a relatively small but busy street, which even with the double glazing you can hear but soon get used to. Overall the hotel is really quite smart, but there are some temporary looking fire doors and partitions which don't look finished off in the public areas, almost as an afterthought or regulatory requirement. The room was great, it felt fairly luxourious with plenty of room and by far the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed at.... it was absolutely spotless, a real credit to the chamber maids, I even checked behind the TV but still no dust! Plus we also had a jacuzzi bath, which went down a storm with the kids. The staff in general were really friendly and helpful, with great local knowledge that you felt wasn't in any way biased.
