Overall, everything taken into account, this was a really good hotel based on value for money, location, quality etc.I would have given this an excellent review if there wasn't some water stains on the ceiling in the room and they'd finished the fire doors/partitions off.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, great service”
Reviews.Author: mediawise
Reviews.Content: For a stay in Istanbul, this hotel is hard to beat. Not only are the rooms clean & modern, but the management is outstanding in customer service. They have gone out of their way to make our stay a memorable experience. Of course, the breakfast is good, free wifi is high speed, airport pickup is by limo, and major sites are within walking distance, but when you arrive they take a personal interest in making guest feel welcome. Luggage to be stored, no problem. Water in the mini fridge, no charge. Need a cab, they'll make sure that you don't get ripped off. Arrive early in the morning, we'll get a room cleaned for your use. Just a couple of nits - no elevator, only english channel on the TV is BBC, and take their map directions and hotel location to heart, it is easy to get lost. I only wish we could clone the Basilieus for every city we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. You'll love it.”
Reviews.Author: novalane
Reviews.Content: Basileus Hotel is the place to stay when visiting Istanbul. It is not only the hotels location in the historic part of the city but the wonderful staff that make this hotel stand out. The always enthusiastic staff, happily advised us when we had a query: from where the best Baclava shop is to organising our car hire. The hotel itself is in a perfect location for exploring the multitude of wondrous historic sites in Istanbul. After a long flight we were delighted when we arrived at the hotel before breakfast hoping to just drop off our bags when staff ushered us to the breakfast room whilst a room was prepared for us. This service continued throughout out stay which changed from 3 nights to 6 as we kept adding more nights to our stay. The rooms are clean and spacious. With wifi and air-conditioning. We stayed in two different rooms and they were both really good. Also, the hotel has a laundering service as well as other things. Directly across the road from the hotel is a restaurant with delicious meals for both vegetarians as well as meatlovers. There is also a convenience store nearby. We were lucky enough to have a five week holiday in Turkey including a 7,000km road trip, (our car hire organised by hotel staff). Their advice about places we should not miss (often far from the mainstream route), was invaluable and made our trip a dream holiday. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul. Just make sure you book for enough nights as there is so much to see and do in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and close to the main sites and transportation”
Reviews.Author: judyisreadytogo
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything we could have needed or wanted. The staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating -- offerring great advice on sights, transportation, and restaurants. The location was walking distance to the Blue Mosque and all of the major sites in Old Istanbul, and also the nice-sized Arasta Bazaar and an adjacent restaurant area. The breakfast at the hotel was terrific -- eggs made to order in addition to a wide-range of items on the buffet table. The room was comfortable and clean, with a turkish carpet on the floor and a desk. The bathroom was very clean and medium-sized, with a tub-shower combination. Although in an older building, all was newly renovated. A very good restaurant is just across the street out the door of the hotel -- turkish specialties at down-to-earth prices. Will definitely stay here again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with sympathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: 758aroundmyworld
Reviews.Content: Nicely located (in Sultanahmet, where most of the tourist hotels are located), this newly renovated hotel offers a pleasant stay. The staff is very sympathetic and helpful. They provide a gratis transfer to or from the airport, wireless, hot water, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out”
Reviews.Author: TeeBow
Reviews.Content: Good place, good price, clearn, very friendly and helpful staff. Close to lots of things, would highly recommend this as a hotel for a couple or for business.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed there during an excursion from Bodrum”
Reviews.Author: zaf1122
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking at their ratings from trip advisor and the room charge was reasonable. I booked the flights and at the same time booked the hotel. At the hotel we were collected by a mercedes people carrier that took us straight to the hotel. We booked in and Yusuf was very helpful making us feel at home. The best points about the hotel is the location is near the places you want to visit just a walking distance about 5 mins away. We were given advice on what we can do during our stay and decided to explore the old city and during the two days we visited many places. The room was tidy, well maintained and spacious for a family. The bathroom was clean and tidy also. The room was recently refurbished it seemed and we were more than pleased by the room. Outside it can be rather noisy mainly because the hotel was close to the tourist spots yet the windows were double glazed and kept the noise out. I loved the air conditioning compared to where we stayed in Bodrum. Breakfast was good, i liked it had an egg omelette and then breakfast with tea, juice. There was plenty to eat there. Summing up.... I would go and stay there again if i ever went to Istanbul again, helpful staff who are caring and with a clean hotel that is close to the tourist spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff....outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristin W
Reviews.Content: Basileus Hotel is very conveniently located close to the top-sights in Istanbul - Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace,basilica cistern,grand bazaarâ€¦.We were given an overview of the hotel facilities and once checked in taken to the room. The room had fresh fruit and a gift from the hotel (our anniversary). The room was large and very comfortableÂ  shower and bath.It was also my birthday while staying here and without prompting they produced a cake with candles on and wished happy birthday on our return from the day out sightseeing while enjoying a glass of apple tea. These are just a few examples of the attention to detail and real care the staff take to make sure you are happy and comfortable.Breakfast buffet has a variety of dishes both hot and cold, both intentionally and locally highly recommended... I would totally recommend to anyone to stay here, and will be returning for a spring . summer trip in the near future.......

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel! Read my review for really excellent tips/advice to maximize your Istanbul experience :)”
Reviews.Author: tigorbear
Reviews.Content: Our travelling party consisted of 3 adults and two small children (4 and 5 years old). We stayed for 4 nights in early October and found the Basileus Hotel to be a very warm and inviting place! We booked from their website and took advantage of their complimentary airport pick up service which is only available if you book from their website. Reception upon arrival was very genuinely friendly - Yusuf and Eco were so nice! They sat us down and gave us lots of tips and advice about looking around Istanbul and were always ready to answer our questions if we had any :) We booked a family room which could accomodate all of us and it was clean, comfortable and pleasant. Pleant of hot water every day and comfy beds. Little to no street noise, and our room was located towards the front! Room is cleaned daily, and the traditional Turkish breakfast each morning was yum and pleasant :) I loved the ricotta filled spring rolls! The hotel location is excellent - about 8 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and from there you're pretty much near lots of other places including the Haga Sofia, and this great strip lined with beaut cafes and restaurants. It rained on two days we were there, so we invested in a couple of good umbrellas (dont pay more than 10liras for one) but if you have a rain poncho, that will definitely help. ** GREAT TRAVELLING TIPS FOR ISTANBUL ** Who says you cant see a lot with small children in your travelling party? :) Did I also mention that I was 4.5 months pregnant when we went on our holiday? :) We planned our intinerary very very well and saw HEAPS even though we had kids with us AND it was raining on two days. Day 1: After checking in, we went to see the Blue Mosque. HAT TIP: they close up the mosque just before and just after each prayer time, so avoid going on those times (you'll know its the time to pray because the azhan (or call to prayer) will take place. You'll be approached by local people insisting on giving you tour guides, but avoid these people because they will hound you for money afterwards. We then had dinner at one of the restaurants on that strip I mentioned above. HAT TIP: dont go to the FIRST restaurant on the strip coz they tend to be the most expensive. Just walk up a little more, peer into some alleyways and you'll find some great places to eat with lots of choices and warm genuine hospitality. Day 2: We did Tokapi Palace first thing in the morning. Getting there bright and early before the gates open is essential because by the afternoon its soooo packed with tour groups you cant enjoy the grounds without being in crowds. Best tip to give you about Tokapi Palace: Do the Harem absolutely first thing! Get it out of the way. Its the most popular part of the Palace (kinda like the Mona Lisa at the Lourve). Once we were inside the grounds, we went straight to the Harem and was able to enjoy walking around it, taking photos, reading about it with just a handful of people around. You have to pay a little extra to enter this part, but I would recommend it. We found getting one audio guide for this part was helpful. Overall spent 4 hours there. Now the Archeology Museum is right next door, but its not open on Mondays so keep that in mind. After Tokapi Palace, we had lunch in a cute cafe, than it was straight to Basicilia Cistern. Absolutely amazing place, highly recommend. Be mindful tho coz it gets slippery when its raining! After that, we took a tram and spent some time at the Grand Bazaar where you can haggle people for prices and see lots of great things :) Do most of your souvenior shopping here. HAT TIP: Be prepared to walk away if the seller doesnt give you the price you want. Chances are they'll call u back and give you the price you want. My husband and I did the 'good cop, bad cop' routine - where he would be the eager buyer, and I would be the nagging wife who was "positive we could get it cheaper else where" - as soon as my husband would go "my wife says no coz its too expensive" we found sellers were quick to give the price the 'wife' wanted haha Mean but it works ;)) Day 3: Up and early to see the Haga Sofia. Again you'll be hounded by locals wanting to give you private tours, but we found it more cost effective and comfortable to hire those audio guides and take our time looking around. Dont forget to go upstairs! After that it was straight to the Archeology Museum. Then it was a tram to the Spice Bazaar. After a nice dinner, we went to Hodjapasha Culture Centre to watch a traditional Turkish culture dance. It wasnt the one with the men in dresses twirling around but very gyspy style with bright colours and festive music. BEST HAT TIP TO GIVE YOU: Reserve your seats well in advance!!!!!!!!!!! We emailed the centre a week before and asked for front row, centre seats and they were honestly the best freakin seats in the house. Felt sorry for the poor folks in the back row who had to stand many times. I would highly recommend this show, even the kids enjoyed it!! :) HAT TIP: Make sure you go to the toilet BEFORE you have the complimentary drinks and snacks during intermission. The line is MASSIVE just before the show starts again and you just may miss the first 5 minutes of the next part of the show! Day 4: Caught a tram to Taksim Square which is a lovely pleasant stroll thru the city. If you're into old maps, there is a map store we found there where we found some old maps of the old Constantinople which we had framed when we got home :) We headed towards Gataca Bridge (took a few hours to get there, but it was a pleasant day and we took our time) and had lunch at one of the cafes underneath Gataca Bridge. HAT TIP: Test the restaurant toilets BEFORE you dine in, coz we found one awesome looking restaurant we ALMOST ate in, but the toilets didnt flush and they had no running water at the taps! Dont be fooled that a great looking restaurant will have a nice toilet. Afterwards we did the Bosphorus ferry cruise that lasted about 90 minutes :) Get there early to score good upper deck seats but bring a jacket and scarves coz it gets chilly! Day 5 (last day): Check out isnt until 12pm so we looked around the area after breakfast and found a nice little mosque about 2 minutes walk from the hotel that has its own history. We walked down to the river and let the kids play in the playground. We paid a little extra to get the shuttle bus to return us to the airport because it was worth it than taking a taxi :) So overall an AWESOME experience in Istanbul. If we managed with two small children and me being pregnant, as an adults-only travelling party its definitely easy to do all the above in just a few days. Other hat tips include using the loo (and making the kids use the loo) every opportunity you can, because sometimes a place will only have squat toilets or the public toilets dont flush (or are filthy). Take small breaks every now and then, when the kids get tired. 15 minutes of rest time is worth it. When ordering food, try different things - dont always just stick to 'western' style food, be adventurous! Turkey is known for great food!! Have their traditional tea every now and then, and the baklava too! Yum yum :)) Oh there is a cute awesome little restaurant directly in front of the hotel - try it out once, it had great service and food. But dont come during 'peak' hours (7pm+) it gets so busy you wont find a table! We came early and scored a great table upstairs next to the fireplace :))

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ricepudding7
Reviews.Content: It took the taxi driver a while to find the hotel but once we were there, the location was great, it's within walking distance to all major attractions. The staff were extremely helpful, the room was spacious and clean. The breakfast was outstanding, with lots of choices. We had a positive experience and difintely will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: rattenpakker
Reviews.Content: Good location in the centre of the old city. Very helpfull, friendly and polite staff. Clean rooms, good breakfast. One detail: mattresses were too hard for my back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CatNap9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Basileus Hotel for 2 nights and we felt that the managers and staff went above and beyond when it came to helping with advise, recommendations and reservations. Our room was clean and comfortable with a fridge with refreshments - all complimentary. Our room was also very quiet, which is hard to come by in a bustling city of 14 million. Breakfast was also delicious. Our favorite was drip coffee - as much as you wanted - also hard to come by. It was a cold buffet breakfast, however, they also will make omelets for you and a turkish coffee to finish up. When we returned to Istanbul (after touring around Turkey) we were to stay at the Basileus again, but they had accidentally lost our reservation. They told us to come to the hotel and they will take care of everything. They carried our bags to another, much higher end hotel, almost next door, which would have cost us about 50% more, but all was taken care of and we got it for the same price quote to us for the Basileus. And even though we had a 5:30 am departure for the airport, the Basileus asked us down for coffee and said that they would box up a breakfast for us to go. A big thank you to everyone at the Basileus for your hospitality. We will definitely stay with you again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieDW
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler, and I, as well as another couple with whom we were traveling, had a wonderful three night (+) night stay at Basileus Hotel! Yusuf and his staff were amazing, and the location is really great for exploring the major sites of the Old City. We were actually diverted to Istanbul a day earlier than expected because of the strikes in Athens, and the staff at Basileus were incredibly helpful and responsive in finding us a nearby hotel (they were unfortunately booked that night) at an identical rate and dealing with all of the baggage transfer involved. They were also wonderful throughout our stay in Istanbul in recommending restaurants, tours, and communicating with the airlines (who had lost some of our bags). The staff was also incredibly welcoming of my 17 month old son, and were always ready to greet him with a smile or a hug. Our room was on the third floor and was lovely and spacious, although the water pressure in the shower was not the best. My husband found the bed a little too firm, but I thought it was pretty comfortable. Breakfast was good (definitely ask for an omelette!) and we appreciated the always available internet-accessible computer. I would definitely stay here again on return to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Carbosq
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the basileus hotel unfortunately only for 2 days for business reason after reading Tripadvisor rewievs .I am glad Tripadvisor didnâ€™t surprise me. Everything was enourmously well.Staff was extraordinary,room was good.Breakfast was rich and good selections.Staff helped me with everything as i was staying short term i needed to see the city and joining a tour was the best option .The staff arranged very nice tour for me.I was recommended very nice restaurants , i enjoyed food so much. Istanbul is beautiful city.For sure i will come back to Istanbul and i will stay in Basileus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: bjorgk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister at the Basileus Hotel for a week (business+vacation). The staff was all exceptionally friendly and ready to recommend various sights, restaurants and where to go for an authentic turkish experience. On my many trips, this is probably the hotel with the warmest welcome that I have experienced! We arrived well after midnight and were sent straight to the room with check-in formalities postponed until the following morning. There is no elevator but our luggage was brought up to the room for us and down again for our departure. The hotel is an extremely good value for the price and the staff even encouraged us to change our booking after arrival when they found out that we would only be two in a triple room due to a fellow traveller having to drop out unexpectedly. We still had the same room but at a slightly lower price. I found this an exceptional guesture as hotels generally want to earn as much as possible. The room was big enough, clean and newly done up. The bathroom had a jacuzzi bathtub with a shower, the temperature of the water was a bit tricky to control but that was not a major issue. AC was very poweful. With the windows closed there is very little street noise, although the street has a busy traffic during the day and there are three mosques nearby that regularly call for prayer. The beds are very firm, which suited my sister but I personally prefer a not so firm mattress. Breakfast buffet had plenty of choices with both a turkish and an international twist. Every morning we were offered freshly made omelets. We enjoyed the local choices for bread, cheese, olives, tomatoes, fresh and dried fruit, nuts and different types of fruit juices. There is no restaurant at the Basileus Hotel but the Tarihi Cesme restaurant across the street is a great choice for a friendly local restaurant with good food and reasonable prices. The lobby has a computer with internet for guests to use and there is plenty of magazines to check out and tourist information brochures. WIFI in our room was very weak so we used the lobby computer instead. The hotel has a good location for the major sights in the old part of Istanbul. We experienced first hand the terrible traffic in Istanbul when going to the Hilton in Nisantasi quarter for work related events. I would recommend to anyone that mainly will be focusing on the old part of town to stay in a hotel there, as travelling relatively short distances by car in Istanbul can take a very long time, especially during rush hour. We asked the hotel to arrange transfer between Ataturk airport and the Basileus, mainly because of our late arrival. I would recommend this option. In Istanbul there can be streets with the same or similar name in more that one part of town, so keeping the street address and phone number of the hotel with you is essential. The taxi driver will then be able to phone the hotel asking for directions if he's unsure of the location. One final tip would be to print out a Google map of the areas that you will be spending time in as hotel maps aren't detailed enough. This will save you a lot of time trying to find your way through the small streets in the older parts of Istanbul. But when you get lost, we found out that local people are always willing to help you out :)

Reviews.Title: “Best of Istanbul, with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: atwoodexplores
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 6 nights at Basileus Hotel, and had an almost perfect stay. This was due in large part to the outstanding hospitality, service and knowledge of the Basileus Hotel staff . Immediately upon entry, we were treated like long-lost friends. Muharrem, Yusuf and Eko are some of the friendliest and most enjoyable people we have ever met during our years of travel. Their pride in Istanbul, their willingness to share was top-notch. I highly recommend Basileus for its convenient location, clean hotel, and generous 'family' environment. *Location* Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, central to many sites. Great for walkers! ~ 5-7 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. ~ 7-9 minutes walk to Tram station. ~ 20 minutes walk to Grand Bazaar. Multiple restaurants within walking distance, many w/views of Blue Mosque. *Hotel Cleaniness* Well-maintained and comfortable lobby. Clean, simply decorated room. We had a double bed. Good AC, when needed. Shower water, a little weak. *Breakfast* Nice selection of breads, fruits, yogurts, juices, teas. Includes choice of omelette, turkish coffee. *Staff* Outstanding, one of the most hospitable people we've met. Very kind. Personable, sat down and spoke to us for a good 20 minutes when we first arrived to get to know us, talk to us about Istanbul, help us organize our days. Conversed with us everyday, w/sincere interest in what we did, what we enjoyed, how else they can help. Fun, showed us turkish coffee cup reading. Thank you again Basileus. Sofia and I had a fantastic time. We're only sorry that we couldn't stay longer. We look forward to our next trip one day.

Reviews.Title: “No taxi driver can find this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sbwil
Reviews.Content: Although the concierge was very helpful, the room was fine, and the buffet breakfast was excellent, Basileus Hotel has two problems. First, there is no elevator, but they will very kindly take your bags up and down for you. I am over 60 and have a bad knee, so the two floor climb was uncomfortable for me. Secondly, not one of the 3 taxi drivers we used could find the hotel even using the map provided on their business card! If we stay there again we will just get dropped off at the Blue Mosque and walked back from there. The room was nice enough and very clean, but the walls seemed a little thin (or we were just unlucky enough to room next to a man who started each day by coughing up a lung!). They are doing some renovation and making this hotel a gem in the middle of Sultanhamet. The Basileus recommended restaurant across the street, Cesme, was fabulous and very inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST- Host, hotel and location!!”
Reviews.Author: JammyIndia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Basileus in October and found it to be one of our best stays amongst years of travel. Right from helping us checking us in, way early, to getting us a taxi for departure, Mr Yusuf was par excellence. He was extremely warm and helpful. He personally guided us for shopping (carpets), Bosphorous cruise and the important sights. Which by the way, are all a beautiful 'shopping and eating' walking distance from this hotel. The hotel itself is located in a very pretty locality. The interior of the lobby is very ornate and opulently done up, with a bunch of good magazines to read. The room (triple) was very aesthetically decorated, very clean with huge full walled windows covered with pretty sheers and small balconies overlooking the street. Bright and airy. The bathroom was very very clean too with a jacuzzi bath tub. The wi-fi is free in the rooms with a computer in the lobby. The breakfast was a good spread, cereal, milk, coffee, juices, eggs made to order, breads, cheese, a variety of berries and fruits and more. (The 4, 5 delicious varieties of berries that we tasted here, we bought for our home form the spice market!). We were offered breakfast on the day we reached, even though we were late yet very early for the check in. A very warm gesture on the hotel's behalf. For the reasonable price we paid, it was a steal. I would most certainly recommend this hotel with the most courteous and hospitable host. Thank you very much Mr Yusuf. We loved your hotel and Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Such a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Trisha48
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights after a short tour to Cappadocia and Selcuk. We had a wonderful time here (as we did throughout Turkey which we would recommend to anyone). If we had any questions, they were answered in great detail. When we went on our day trip to Gallipoli, a packed breakfast was provided. The location of the Basileus Hotel was marvellous as it is walking distance to most of the tourist attractions of Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. It is also a short walk from the Sultanahmet tram stop if you want to take public transport from the airport. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with a huge variety and, as so many people have commented, eggs are cooked to order. We too can recommend the omelettes. For any females travelling by themselves, we found Istanbul (and Turkey in general) a safe destination. When it was obvious we were lost as we were reading a map, there was always someone who stopped to help. We found this when we were trying to locate the Basileus Hotel which is a little difficult to find. If we ever return to Istanbul, we will stay at the Basileus Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly hosts....excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RACER283
Reviews.Content: Basileus Hotel, in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. It's hard to imagine a more wonderful group of people operating a Hotel in Istanbul. From the moment we arrived we were treated with great warmth and hospitality. Eko, Yusuf and Muharrem did absolutely all they could to make our stay enjoyableâ€¦..from the excellent restaurant choices to suggestions on seeing the sights. You are in the heart of the old city and as others have mentioned, you are within 10 minutes walk of so many famous sights. (Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi just a few minutes more. We had superb breakfast each of the 4 mornings we were thereâ€¦.and what a selectionâ€¦.cereal, breads, yogurt, cold meats, cheese, juices and coffees etc. Onar would even cook you an omelette if you so desired. Although it doesn't have a restaurant, the rating below is for the breakfast provided. Beds in Turkey may be a little firmer than back home but that didn't bother us. The room was large, extremely clean and was air conditioned. We would not hesitate to stay again. Istanbul is a fascinating and vibrant cityâ€¦â€¦.Turkey is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: larry m
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our Turkish vacation at the Basileus. They made us feel welcome and at home from the moment we entered. Their entire staff's friendly and professional service made us feel we were leaving friends when our stay ended. Nice clean rooms, large and varied breakfast (good omelets to order), and convenient location to major sites. The Basileus was our first introduction to true Turkish hospitality and helped make our vacation quite memorable.

Reviews.Title: “We'd love to come back”
Reviews.Author: luciajacobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Basileus for a total of seven nights and were favourably impressed with their very friendly service and professional aproach. Nothing was too much trouble for the young and enthusiastic staff and Eko and Yusuf arranged for us to see a carpet repairer, booked tickets for a dervish show, restaurants etc and gave us excellent advice for restaurants and shopping as well as arranging a private car when we needed one as that turned out to be a good option for the four of us. We found the beds comfortable, the bathroom practical and it is all spotlessly clean. We enjoyed the plentiful breakfasts. All in all an excellent place to stay for tourists who want to explore old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arlenetravels
Reviews.Content: If you like firm beds, this is the place. I do, and it was a little firm even for me. The room was clean, comfortable, attractive. Bathroom was nice, but water pressure a little iffy. Location is good--It's a short uphill walk to the major tourist destinations and the tram. Breakfast was good. Buffet of cold items, juices, and tea. Omelets made to order were a nice touch.Be sure to map the hotel before you arrive because it's hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: cittaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Basileus for 5 nights and I enjoyed it very much. The staff is kind and helpful and the location is very good. Breakfast is a variety of breads, cheeses, meats, olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, yogurt, cereal, dried dates, apricots, and my favourite: warm cake with chocolate chips! You can also order omelettes to your liking. The beds were a bit hard for our liking, but hopefully they will soften up once more people come through. The only inconvenience was that after two nights we had to move to a different room. Probably due to overbooking, which we encountered a couple more times in our 3 week trip. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again!”
Reviews.Author: HaamidAli
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Location is very convenient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You will feel like home”
Reviews.Author: bonniejeanlynn
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find fault with anything at Basileus. Its location is perfect: just a block away from Little Sophie and about 10--15 minute stroll to Grand Bazaar. The rooms are remarkably clean and comfortable. The breakfast is delicious, with omelettes made to your liking. But probably best thing about Basileus is its staff. The owner and his assistants treat you like cousins who have popped in for a visit. They want to be sure that you see and do exactly what is best for you in the beautiful city of Istanbul. Another plus is the restaurant across the street: Cesme. Try its Chef Salad for an added plus to your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Come as strangers, leave as family!”
Reviews.Author: Mamabren
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had an excellent stay at the Basileus hotel. After our first night we were given a bigger room on the second floor. The staff here is the most hospitable we have ever experienced. Muharrem, the owner, spends lots of time at the hotel giving his guests information on the sites, tours and restaurants in the area. All of the young men who work here are warm and make you feel like you are staying in their home. On the morning we left to visit other parts of Turkey 2 of the young men were up at 4 AM to help with our luggage and to make sure we got off safely. I was having difficulty contacting United Airlines while there and I was given their phone and they helped get me get in touch with the right person (not an easy thing to do when you're traveling in another country). Everything you want to see and do in Sultahmet (the Old City) is within walking distance. Breakfast is plentiful with a made to order omelette and Turkish coffee included. I can't say enough about this hotel, the owner (Muharrem) and staff (Yusef, Eko and Omar).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in many ways”
Reviews.Author: julie t
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I had the most wonderful experience staying at this hotel. The room was roomy for 3, the included breakfast was very nice, but the best part was the staff. We were warmly greeted and given information on Istanbul, including restaurants that were excellent and low cost. As three women travelling together, we were treated with respect and felt very comfortable at this hotel, so close to many major sites. Very reasonable prices, and upon request, they arranged transportation to and from the hotel, and also gave us a referral for a day trip to Ephesus. They promptly replied to my emails, and after our visit, sent us a thank you email.

Reviews.Title: “Remarks”
Reviews.Author: lakegeorge20
Reviews.Content: my recommendation for anyone would be that if visiting Istanbul then Basileus hotel is the prime place to stay in. the hotel service is excellent and the staff is extremely hospitable. the location as well is prime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Basileus”
Reviews.Author: molvianzar
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome experience in Basileus hotel. the room, staff, food everything there is top notch, i would always stay in this hotel whenever I visit Istanbul again, InshaAllah. I would recommend all to make their stay in this hotel during their visit in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seon Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped here on our honeymoon for 3 nights and couldn't have asked for more in a hotel. Basileus was clean and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful--everytime we walked by the front desk they were always helping guests. The location is great-a brisk 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque- but the hotel is in a quieter area away from the tour groups and buses. We would definitely recommend this place to friends and family. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff - Excellent location for old town - Great breakfast - Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: FredSmithBoston
Reviews.Content: Clean and neat. Bathroom modern with small Jacuzzi. Beds large and comfortable. Helpfulness of the staff and their warmth is lasting memory. Any review should have at least one drawback and the only one I can think of is that there isn't an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jarotic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughters and my mom in July, we were all impressed with the hospitality. We had a great time and we would return again. Thanks for making our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: driss m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had delightful stay at the Basileus, very friendly place,delicious breakfast with lots of variety,the service from the staff of this hotel is second to none,very clean, up to date and the beds were very comfortable.I would highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with GREAT staff.”
Reviews.Author: Cortunefookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights, and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel itself nothing too exciting, but it is very good value. The rooms are fairly basic, but quite large and spotlessly clean. I found the bed and pillows to be very comfortable. The location is good. It is on a fairly quiet street, but only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and lots of restaurants. The staff were fantastic. Without exception everyone we dealt with was incredibly friendly and helpful. They all went out of their way to assist us whenever they could. We had one small problem arise with our transport, which they took care of for us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Jesshope123
Reviews.Content: Incredible staff, couldn't have asked for more. A perfect hotel in a great location. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be well taken care of at Basileus”
Reviews.Author: Carole29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Basileus for 5 nights in July and were so happy with the service and hospitality. Moharem and everyone at the front desk went out of their way to make our stay comfortable ... and even went as far as calling other hotels on our trip to re-organize our schedule for the better. The breakfast every morning was excellent. In a place so far from home, we felt welcomed and taken care of at Basileus. We missed that kind of care as soon as we left! The location of the hotel is very convenient to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate rooms and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Leafsgirl77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Istanbul for 3 nights at the Basileus in the Sultanahmet area. The hotel is located very close to some of the major sites of this area (ie. Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia). Spice Bazaar and Grand Bazaar were both within walking distance but you could also get a quick tram as well. Taxi was easiest to get over to the other parts of the city I found. If you're looking for a more modern ' nightlife', you may prefer to stay in another part of the city. The room I was in was incredible spacious, clean and comfortable. Compared to the shoe boxes of Paris, this was a delight. There was free wifi in the room as well. Airport transfers went very smoothly. They organized some laundry for me and had it back within the day. This was my first time to Turkey, and what really sold me on liking this place so much was the people. Eko in particular was very helpful in giving me some guidance about where to visit and directions. As a solo female traveler, wasn't a hotel that I was going to meet a lot of fellow solo travelers, but what was more important was that I given good advice. Went to visit a friend over in the modern side of the city, and they helped with a few of the language barriers and also ensured I got back to the hotel safely as well (by giving the taxi driver specific directions). The hotel seemed very family friendly as well. Would highly recommend the Basileus if you're looking to visit some of the older sights of the city - it is great value with fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Like a second home!”
Reviews.Author: SJ88Australia
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip-advisor and decided to book as it was rated no3! It did not dissapoint! The rooms were nice and clean. The hotel is in the old tourist area of Istanbul. Breakfast was excellent. We were always offered omlettes and turkish coffee after eating the many hams, meats, cereals, salami, pastries etc! The staff were just excellent. They were very friendly and very helpful! Yusuf is such a good host- pretty sure he was a tour guide- he knows everything about istanbul and will happily show you where to go where to eat where to shop (i said everything) for as long as it takes! Cesme restaurant across the road is a good place to eat...looks like nothing fancy but food was quite good and Yusuf knows when the fish comes in fresh. Was a fantastic experience we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: AlSandiego73
Reviews.Content: I have to confess: I'm one of those annoying, holier-than-thou people who cringe at being called a tourist. Even when I'm doing touristy things, I prefer to identify myself as a "traveller." A petty and insignificant distinction, perhaps, but when I'm on the road I normally steer clear of the tourist havens and traps. Istanbul was a rare exception, however: it was my very first time to a city that I always had wanted to visit, and one cannot go to Istanbul and, well, be a tourist. There's just too much to see. So I embraced this identity and decided to look for a hotel in Sultanahmet, the old part of town where the major sites are (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, Roman Cistern, etc.). But I wanted to make sure that I wasn't choosing just any run-of-the-mill place. I used TripAdvisor as my trusty guide and discovered the Hotel Basileus. After reading the many positive reviews, I figured it would be a safe bet for two nights. The hotel itself is in a mostly residential part of Sultanahmet but is within a short walking distance (uphill but manageable) to the Hippodrome that runs along one side of the Blue Mosque leading to Hagia Sofia. The hotel appears to have three floors plus a basement where breakfast is served. My two friends and I spent the first night on the first floor in a triangular-shaped room with three twin beds. It wasn't the room that the hotel management originally had allocated to us - they apparently didn't realize we needed three separate beds. Anyway it was perfectly fine, and the following day the management offered to move us to another room upstairs - they even transferred all of the luggage for us. Both rooms were simply yet pleasantly decorated, and the bathrooms were ultra-clean and shiny. It was only the second week of June so we didn't find the room to be too hot at night. We thought the breakfast was very ample as other reviewers have stated. There are many options - both savory and sweet - and guests can sit in one of two rooms. On both occasions we chose the room where the food was not being served due to the reduced foot traffic. We didn't really spend that much time in the rooms since we were running around town trying to see as much as we could, but I wholeheartedly recommend the Basileus. What made the difference was the superb customer service we received from the second we arrived to even after our departure (one of my travel companions had left a pair of sunglasses in the room, and the hotel found them and kept them in a safe place). Yusuf and the other clerks sit at a desk right next to the front door, and they are always ready to offer tips and advice. Shortly before we left we asked for a recommendation for lunch at a restaurant not frequented solely by tourists, and Yusuf pointed us to a place just across the street where we sat at an outdoor table. Nothing mind-blowing but perfectly adequate food at decent prices especially for the neigborhood. I need to go back to Istanbul because we never made it to Hagia Sofia (!) or one of the Turkish baths, and I'll be sure to stay at the Basileus again. P.S. A piece of advice straight from the clerk with the light beard whose name I never got: there's a beautiful mosque just a couple of blocks from the hotel called the Sokollu Mehmet Pasha Mosque. It's much smaller than the Blue Mosque but has the same spectacular tiles and was virtually empty when we visited (aside from a tour group of older French people).

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanshkin
Reviews.Content: Yosef and Eko are wonderful hosts and are genuinely glad to assist you with daily excursions, the Turkish language, the culture and any other questions along the way. The breakfasts are delicious, including fresh yogurt, fruit, breads, turkish coffee and omelettes on request. I would be a happy man if I could wake up to this breakfast every day. The hotel is just a few minutes from the Blue Mosque, yet the rooms are pretty quiet. Overall, the hotel is a great bang for your buck and I would highly recommend Basileus to anyone who visits Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Liza M
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Basileus Hotel. It has only been up and running for 8 months, so the place is just getting better and better (not to mention that everything is new and comfortable) - fyi roof terrace is in the works. Sultanahmet is a busy area to stay in, but it is very handy area to be in to see all the must-sees in Istanbul, and the hotel is a short walking distance from all of it. But above all, the guys running the hotel - Muharrem, Yusuf, Eko...are extremely warm, helpful and hospitable. Thanks guys :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eurowent
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Basileus were extremely kind and friendly. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were spotless and looked like they had been newly renovated. The buffet breakfast was very fresh and included an omelette. Location was great, about a three minute walk from the Blue Mosque. We would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended option with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: steveos61
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay here for 5 nights Yusuf and his staff were very helpful in all ways. You get free transfers to and from airport if you stay a few nights or more. Only minor thing was fridge had no cold control and when home from day out touring just wasnt cold enough for beer so staff stored my beer in their fridge. Staff were very helpful with bad service from local bathouse and we were offered free bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for old Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: senaer49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights before a Greek Isle cruise. Easy walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi. A big part was the accommodations, with modern room, great free wifi, wonderful air conditioning, and a generous buffet breakfast. But the best part was the great hotel staff who spoke great English and were actively finding ways to make us feel more comfortable or find ways for us to do things easily or cheaply. The desk clerk even came out and argued with a cab driver who was trying to overcharge us for the trip from the airport! Highly recommend this place for comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JackandChar
Reviews.Content: The Basileus was perfectly suited for our family visit. Everyone made us feel like part of their family. The location is within walking distance of all the must see sites(Blue Mosque etc.) and the staff provided excellent directions. Excellent Breakfast to get the day started and after turkish coffee you will be ready to go. Thanks from the Boland clan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Makala77
Reviews.Content: I started off my stay here in this newer hotel, staff was super accommodating and helpful! I can't say enough for that, I checked in later in the evening and I got a nice tour of the area from the owner of the hotel on his way home. He pointed out the highlights of the area and assisted me in getting an Akbil for public transportation (I highly recommend this if you are staying a few days and plan to travel via tram, metro, buses or ferries since it is good for everything). Rooms/baths were new so very clean and comfortable. Breakfast had a nice selection and very good food. I do plan to return to Istanbul and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended. Service excellent + + +”
Reviews.Author: Vicki093
Reviews.Content: Our family and I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel in May. Apart from being in a great location, central to all the major sites - the rooms are clean, comfortable and the bathrooms and bedding luxurious. The breakfast was one of the best we had on our 3 month trip, especially the fresh juices, yogurt and - as is the Turkish tradition - cheeses. From the time we first contacted the staff about staying they were helpful and friendly - giving us a good deal, arranging travel from the airport and, when we arrived, giving lots of help and advice as to where to go and what to see. Unfortunately our wallet was stolen while we were out on the morning of our last day and the staff spent nearly all day going off with us to the police as translators - looking at CCTV footage and making our statement. Nothing was too much trouble. And when we were leaving very early the next day they got up and made breakfast especially for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at.....”
Reviews.Author: cm201160763
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The generosity and service was outstanding and Yusuf was such a wonderful guide. The hotel rooms are extremely clean and the staff bend over backwards to make your stay the best! It was such a great pleasure staying in Istanbul at this hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to everyone... Thanks again Basileus Hotel! The Australians

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - we were taken care of like old friends!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalAdventureGirl
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul with a group of 8 girls and we stayed at Basileus! Highly recommended for the following reasons: - The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They made every effort to ensure we had a fantastic and safe time in Turkey. The helped us in every way and were fantastic - The location - Perfect to see the main sights of Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Palace, Grand Bazaar - Hotel: Clean and comfortable with a delicious breakfast! I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends and next time I am in Istanbul I will stay here! Thank you to Yusuf and the team!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Incredible People and Service”
Reviews.Author: TheMertzes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I cannot say enough about our incredible experience at this hotel! First, the place is located in walking distance to the major sites. It was very easy to get where we needed to go. Second, the hotel is beautiful, clean and brand new. Our room was spacious and clean with beautiful modern furniture and bathroom. Third and most importantly, Yusuf and Muharrem and the other guys who run the hotel were just wonderful, warm and friendly people! They really went out of there way to take care of all of our needs and then some- from recommending restaurants, activities, food to making sure we had enough to eat at breakfast and an iron for our clothes. Yusuf went out of his way to help us with the uncertainty of our flight from Istanbul to Athens during the time of the riots. He made phone calls, contacted friends and really gave us peace of mind. Muharrem even took us around the city to see the amazing sights! I could not ask for a more wonderful place to stay. We had many friendly chats with them and we really miss them. We left feeling that we truly have friends in Istanbul! I really want to go back and I would not stay anywhere else but here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: uskern
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two days and absolutely loved it! The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms clean and modern and the staff very friendly! The hotel is situated on a small alley 5min from Sultan-Ahmed-mosque. Hardest part was for the taxi driver to find it! The breakfast-buffet is big with meat, cheese, yogurt and fresh fruits. The staff was very helpful and friendly, we felt most welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable cusomer service and location”
Reviews.Author: beanstravels
Reviews.Content: The customer service at Basileus Hotel is one of the best we've experienced. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful in getting us oriented around the city, arranging transportation, and when I asked for help to call a store to see if they had a small appliance I forgot to pack, the guy at the front desk called several stores to find the best price. Location of the hotel is very good. Most of the major sights are witin a 10-20 minute walking distance on the lovely backstreets of Sultanahmet. Once you find your way to and from the Hippodrome, you are good to go: Blue Mosqe, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace are easy to find. The accomodations are new & clean. Basic toiletries and a hairdryer are in the room (bring hair conditioner). The beds are pretty firm, which was fine by us. Ask the front desk for the WiFi password. There are many breakfast choices-plenty to choose from for everyone. Finally, the value if very good considering you are staying in a major capital city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Only positive experiences from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: patpgr
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviewers on TA we booked 2 rooms here for our 3 night stay in Istanbul as the hotel appeared very central for the key sites. All of my dealings with Yusuf by email were very promptly and professionally handled. We were met at the airport as arranged with a very smooth transfer to the hotel. The Basileus is in an ideal spot although during our stay the traffic just outside was heavy (but only during the day thank goodness) due to road works around the Hippodrome area. Our son's room was quite dark and at road level although spacious and very clean. The hotel is small and well run and we would certainly return although I think I'd book (higher level?) superior rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “5* customer service”
Reviews.Author: World-Traveller-one
Reviews.Content: I'm not now at the hotel, nor have I stayed there (my son and his friend currently staying at the Basileus). This is just a "very well done" intended for Yusuf and his colleagues for their hard work in trying to accommodate my last minute and frequently changing requests. As it turned out I cancelled at absolutely the eleventh hour and they were most gracious about it. I'll definitely book the Basileus when next heading to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “If this is your first trip to Istanbul, make The Basileus Hotel your first stop!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGang
Reviews.Content: On June 15 we flew MAS from Kuala Lumpur for a 2 weeks vacation in Istanbul and some parts of Turkey. We arrived early in the morning after a 10 hour flight and were quickly put at ease with a free pick up service arranged by The Basileus Hotel. Our room was not ready and while waiting we were treated to a very welcoming and hearty breakfast and we were checked in by 10am even though the official check in time was 12noon. We reserved a triple room for 3 nights and was given a room in the ground/semi basement floor for the first night and were moved to another triple room on the third floor for the remaining nights. We were told that The Basileus was 8 months old and both rooms were obviously new, very clean, sufficiently furnished with wifi, LCD TV, a well stocked mini fridge and the beds wrapped with high quality sheets. Yusuf and Ekhr ( I hope the spelling is right ) went way out of their ways to recommend and help us with our travel arrangements with a third party travel agent to the outer parts of Turkey - Cappadocia, Pamukale and Silcuk/Ephesus. We wanted to stay at the Basileus after our Turkey excursion but the hotel was fully booked and were arranged by Yusuf and Ekhr to stay in another hotel nearby. In fact it was an upgrade because we were given a room that was brand new ( 8 days old ), with a private terrace and a view of the Marmara Sea! Thank you guys! Yusuf and the team did a great job at making us feel very comfortable. We felt that we were like staying with friends or a close family. We had problem with our mobile phones so we went back to Basileus to ask Yusuf to help us out to call our contact for an apartment reservation at Taksim ( the last 3 nights in Istanbul ). He was more than willing to accommodate our request, managed to connect us with our contact and even checked the area on google earth to tell us about the area we were about to go and the exact building we were about to stay in. The Basileus is located in a good, safe area close to many hotels, restaurants and shops. It's in a neighbourhood where you would have a chance to see how the locals live or even sit down and chat with the locals at a sidewalk cafe while sipping a glass of Cay ( Turkish tea ). All the main attractions, the tram station are only a pleasant stroll away. We have been very fortunate to have The Basileus Hotel as our first stop of a fantastic vacation in Istanbul and the greater Turkey. If this is your first trip to Istanbul and Turkey, try to make The Basileus Hotel your first stop, you will not regret it! Hamdan, Melania and Aleif Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked - didn't get to stay there”
Reviews.Author: IslaBonita77
Reviews.Content: The caveat to my review is that I didn't get actually stay at the Basileus. Based on other TA reviews, I noticed that hotel overbooking is a problem in Istanbul. I consider myself a savvy traveler and am very particular about my hotel reservations. As such, I had records of my email correspondence with the Basileus confirming my one-night stay. I also emailed again the day before I was to arrive to confirm my reservation and alert them that we would be arriving to the hotel late the next evening. I was then told that my reservation was not held because I never sent credit card information to hold the room. A review of my emails revealed that I was never asked to give my credit card information. The response was that they had a cancellation, so luckily, they would have a room for me the next night. Of course, when I arrived, there was no room available. In fact, there was no room for us as well as the party of four that also was waiting in the lobby. Like other stories in Istanbul, we were offered an "upgrade" to a sister hotel. Against my better feelings, we accepted the other room since it was past midnight and we had an early-morning flight. There was nothing wrong with the other hotel, but the principle and practice of overbooking rooms despite explict, written correspondence is poor business. Based on the other reviews, the rooms are nice, but who wants to run this risk with bad management? PS: the internet was down in the lobby, but maybe this was because I was trying to book an alternate hotel on my own at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joeyvegaz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived everybody was so hospitable and helpful. We arrived late and were told to go sleep and deal with the registration in the morning. The hotel seems brand new (not sure how old it is) and every employee is fantastic, especially Yussuf. Breakfast was better than any other hotel during our 10 day stay around Turkey and it includes Omelettes!!! Yussuf helped us book the best tours and gave us great directions helping us to see as much as we could in the unfortunate short time we were there. My wife was sick on our last day and we were offered a later checkout so she could rest AND also a free transfer to the airport. This hotel was nice and great, but the people made it one of the better hotels in which I have stayed. It was close enough to the Mosques, but not too close that when you walked out your doors you were being harassed to buy maps and guidebooks. A great location. The ONLY con was the bed. It was quite hard. But the rest of the hotel more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find !!!”
Reviews.Author: aircsi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for four nights the first week of June and I can say this is an exceptional B and B. The size of the rooms, the cleanliness of the whole hotel, the outstanding breakfast, and the helpfulness of the entire staff of this hotel was hands down the best of our trip. This hotel deserves the high marks that it receives!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: archanavohra
Reviews.Content: Basileus Hotel located very close to Sultanahmet and is walking distance from most of the amazing places in Istanbul including Hagiya Sofiya and Blue Mosque. But that's not what makes it amazing....The family run hotel is great to stay in when travelling with kids or family with the staff taking extra care of all your needs. Infact in our case, we even got a call from the reception when they heard my son crying, saying "is their anything that we can do to help". Ekko and Mohhamat (hope I have the spelt their names right!) were extremely helpful and charming. The breakfast spread can be improved however the staff service at breakfast is exceptional Even though the hotel is not plush or has amenities like a pool; they more than make up for it by trying to go the extra mile for their guests. The rooms and bathrooms are clean; good in size with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim1027
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was excellent and provided great ideas for restaurants and places to see. The hotel is brand new and the rooms are perfect. The rooftop patio was not opened yet but will be soon. Close to lots of historical sites, and wonderful things to see. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, central location for historic area.”
Reviews.Author: DKB-LA
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Istanbul from 5 in the evening until the next morning so decided to spend the night and see what we could. Basileus Hotel arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport and when we arrived at the hotel they made us feel right at home. Understanding our jet lag and limited time, the staff made us some Turkish coffee and marked on a map what we could hope to accomplish that evening. The room was clean and comfortable and we slept great. The next day we had to leave for the airport prior to when breakfast is normally served so they opened the breakfast room 15 minutes early and cooked us a delicious omelet. The hotel is well situated for seeing the historic section and the staff is beyond helpful. There were three of us and the room was spacious and comfortable. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Innuit
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone and as such much prefer to stay somewhere homely. Basileus hotel is such a home away from home, welcomed like an old friend every time I walked through the door, nothing was too much for the great group of staff who work there. Even to the point of walking me across the road to find a place to enjoy the fine wine of Turkey! The rooms are clean, comfortable and the location is perfect for exploring the old town and areas such as Grand Bazaar and the Blue mosque

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Location was Great!”
Reviews.Author: BMR2723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Basileus from May 20-23 and we were extremely happy with our choice. Starting before the trip, I had sent emails asking questions about what we should plan before we left for the trip and I received quick responses and reassurance that no plans were needed and they would help us as soon as we get to the hotel. We were provided with a free airport transfer due to a promotion and that was seamless. We arrived at the hotel within 30 minutes (max). We were greeted with tea/coffee and we checked in. We were advised to relax in our room for a little and when we were settled we would go through a mini overview of Istanbul. The overview was great (where to catch the metro, key things to see, etc.) they provided us with pamphlets and brochures for tours, but they were not pushy about it (we opted for a private tour that we got to pick the key sights we wanted to go to). On a side note about the private tour (we noticed that tour guides get to go to the front of the line to buy tickets for the major sights so it made our tour more efficient than doing it on our own - well worth the 60 euros!). The hotel made all reservations that we needed and arranged our transfer back to the airport (and carried our bags two blocks so that we would not get stuck in the traffic jam). Room was spacious, good size for a hotel so close to all the sights in old town. The bathroom was a good size as well. My only criticsm would be the firmness of the bed...but it didn't affect my sleep so not a big deal. The location was within a 5 minute walk (uphill) to Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagi Sofia, Basillica Cistern, and Topkapi Palace. The Grand Bazaar is approx. 15 minute walk. The Spice Bazaar was 15 minutes on the metro. The only time we took a cab was from Galata Tower area back to the hotel (which cost 14tl). The metro was very convenient. The breakfast had the best selections of all the places we stayed throughout our trip in Turkey. As with other reviews we were there when the road around the hotel was under construction, and as per other reviews it does get a little noisey from time to time, but we were on the first floor right at the corner where the traffic jam was and during the night while we were sleeping we were not bothered by the noise (we weren't in the room from 9am-10pm).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: BryP
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a City Break. Very clean, very comfy beds with proper duvets. Simple breakfast. Extremely helpful staff who spent half an hour with a map on our arrival showing us where to go, they even booked us a table at a restaurant one night and organised a taxi there. Rooms on ground floor are a bit noisy but on all other floors are fine. Very good value for the price. They also have triple rooms which are great for three children or teenagers. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Noise!”
Reviews.Author: pillhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Basileus for 5 nights. Room size was fine - no tea/coffee facility. Bathroom was also fine. Cleaning was efficient. Breakfast variety good. However noise of traffic is a problem at present due to the road around the Hippodrome/Blue Mosque being relaid. As a result a stream of traffic comes down the hill right past the hotel from early morning and this can be pretty noisy. Not the fault of the hotel who have a notice apologising for the noise but if you are booking the Basileus check out if the roadworks have been completed. Apart from that, it's in a good location - provided you don't moind walking up a fairly steep hill to get to Sultanahmet main area. We came on the metro and tram from airport thinking that we could walk to hotel but roadworks stymied that. It would also have been quite a trudge uphill with cases.

Reviews.Title: “superb personal service”
Reviews.Author: pilliongirl
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little family run hotel that is neat, simple and clean. Ekhrim and his family are gently welcoming and will give advice, book tickets. You couldn't ask for more. In time, they may finish their roof terrace which will make it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: aussieandfrenchman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Basileus Hotel for three nights and it was wonderful. It is in a great location, being in the old city but just far away enough from all the tourist hot spots. The staff were really helpful - they gave us a very warm welcome and also tips on what to see all around Istanbul - the Bosphorous cruise was our most memorable day! The rooms are very spacious and clean and the breakfast is great. We would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Don82
Reviews.Content: Basileus is an excellent small hotel. The staff were very friendly, honest, and very efficient from the pick-up at Ataturk Airport to taking our cases to the nearby shuttle for the return. Yusuf, the manager, couldn't have been more helpful. The position is tops - quiet but within easy walking distance of the major attractions and close enough for a stroll along the esplanade of the Sea of Marmora. Plenty of restaurants nearby. The room was very clean, modern (not to say smart), and comfortable, and the breakfast offered lots of choice. Free internet too. We slept well and felt very much at home. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel made brilliant by its staff”
Reviews.Author: Mowlie
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Basileus, not least because of the welcome and ongoing service we received from Youseff. He was like a personal guide to the best restaurants in the city, ensuring we ate exceptionally and also planned our days so we covered the right sites in the time we had in Istanbul. Hotel itself was clean, had brilliant breakfasts, and decent sound proofing so the early morning calls to prayer were muffled sufficiently so not to wake us. It was a little difficult to find due to the map provided by Hotels.com. But very straight forward once you know. Definitely recommend if staying in Sultanahmet

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, friendly small hotel just 10 mins from Blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: chesilfan
Reviews.Content: Well deserves its rating. Great reception from Yusuf and his colleagues. Based in an improving part of Sultanhamet, the hotel is within easy walking distance of the major sites. Rooms very comfortable. For our last night before returning home, we had a ground floor room looking out on the steep road, but we were not affected by traffic noise. Expensive? We did not think so for what we got; excellent service, generous breakfast including a near compulsory cheese omelette cooked byYusuf himself, and loads of advice on where to go..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: christbrasil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at basileus 5 days.It was my first trip to Ä°stanbul and I really enjoyed the city by staying there.The staff of Basileus was really kind, helpfull and well-informed about the city and do their best to help you in every subject you need. The hotel is very clean, new, recently decorated .The rooms are really big and nice.The location is perfect as it is in the heart of Old city. You can easily go almost all the attractions on foot.It is also close to Marmara sea where you can go for a walk.I definetely recommend people who would like to visit Ä°stanbul .

Reviews.Title: “Our Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: TravelIHKarachi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic people and good, clean functional rooms and bathrooms. The staff is very helpful and give you the correct advise on where to go and how to go for sightseeing. Yusuf the Manager, Moharram and Benyamin were all great and always smiling and never said no to any of our demands! They have complimentary Turkish coffee at the lobby and were always ready to serve you. We often stay at 5 star hotels who have all the extra facilites such as gym, pool, restaurants etc. However, when you are in a Historical city such as Istanbul, you are more inclined to visit the sights and bazaars rather than use the hotel facilities. Hence Basileus is perfect as it is walking distance to all the historical sites. It does not have all the fancy facilities yet has all the "right" facilities that a Hotel room should have. Clean rooms with new furniture and a very comfy bed, clean bathrooms, minibar, TV and free wifi. What more can you ask for! Really enjoyed the breakfast, especially the breads. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: GutoFrohlich
Reviews.Content: Basileus is strategically located at the heart of Sultanahmet, close to everithing. Staff is very dedicated to make host's trip a success.

Reviews.Title: “Newly furnished rooms. Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Socal_Johnny
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in Basileus for a couple of days upon arrival in Istanbul. This hotel offers reasonable price within walking distance to all the sights in Sultanahmet. Prices are a little high in general, but probably in reasonable considering the surrounding hotels and high demand to be in this area. Soundproofing on the rooms was good, allowing you to sleep through the 5AM call to prayer though it helps to become accustomed to hearing it a few times so you're not startled awake. One bonus to staying here is the excellent restaurant called Tarihi Cesme across the street from Basileus. Speaking of food, breakfast at Basileus is a treat, with a wide variety of items from the traditional olives, eggs, cucumbers, tomatos, cheese, honey, and omelets made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veysan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, rooms are nice and the staff very kind, friendly and helpfull. It's a super stay because it feels like your second home!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful but bit pricey and noisy”
Reviews.Author: sbandrm
Reviews.Content: Noisy as on a busy road and hill- quite expensive. Very clean. Lovely staff - very helpful and nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor_01
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the Basileus by the reviews on Trip Advisor and stayed for 3 nights at the end of April 2011. The hotel is on a corner approx. two streets in from the city walls and near one of the entrances into Sultanhamet from Kennedy Caddesi. Walking up from it to the corner of the Blue Mosque gardens we did look with a bit of envy at the hotels closer to the top of the hill. The hotel looks pretty newly renovated. It is painted cream throughout, with pretty kilims and a comfortable seating area by the front desk. There are two breakfast rooms in the basement. I didn't notice a lift and there are lots of stairs. We had a room on the first floor, facing the road up to the top of the hill and from about 6:30/7:00 am we had drivers getting into gear to get their vans up the hill. It didn't affect us too much but it could be a bit wearing. Generally we felt the hotel lived up to the Trip advisor reviews, it is attractive and comfortable, in a decent location and good value for money. We thought the guys managing the hotel were really very good: helpful, efficient and pretty good tour advisors if you are wondering where to go, how to get there or what to eat.

Reviews.Title: “The warmest, friendliest and most accomodating staff makes this hotel a gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelNutz50
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Basileus hotel felt like we were visiting with family. The staff really made us feel at home. Yusuf, Moharem, Omer, and Benyumin were so welcoming, humble, hospitable and friendly. Yusuf even took time to show us how to make the perfect cup of Turkish coffee. Though the amenities were basic, the room was immaculate. Breakfast was more than sufficient. Free wifi was a plus. Location is convenient and walking distance to Blue Mosque (~ 10 min walk). Thanks Basileus hotel staff for most memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “tHE BEST PLACE TO STAY ON A BUDGET IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: alaw_home
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 4 nights in Istanbul and stayed at the Basileus. I can honestly say that this is one of the best budget hotels we've ever stayed in. It is in the Sultanahmet district, 5 - 10 minutes walk from all the major sites, however, just on the edge of this district and the Kumpapi district, so very close to the 'real' Istanbul. The staff are welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable; always ready to help, nothing too much trouble. I heard Yusuf 'scolding' a guests for referring to themselves as Tourists - 'you're not tourists, you're visitors' he said! The breakfasts are brilliant, the rooms light and airy and the hotel quiet. Try the 'Balik Ekmek' (literally 'fish bread') in the port at Kumkapi - seriously fresh grilled mackerel, put into warm bread, with salad, lemon juice and salt - amazing! We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anticyra
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel conveniently located in the historic city center of Istanbul within short walking distance to most main sights, including Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Very friendly, well informed and helpful stuff, clean and comfortable rooms, good breakfast. We would totally stay there again and highly recommend this place for anybody who wants to discover the beautiful city of Constantinople. :)

Reviews.Title: “A hotel full of positive energy!”
Reviews.Author: 11Eliana11
Reviews.Content: Me and two friends stayed in Basileus hotel for 4 days a week ago. When we left it was like leaving very good friends. The staff is very professional and so friendly that you will feel like home in a few hours. The whole interior is spotless and the hotel is walking distance from blue mosque and Ayia Sofia. I would strongly recommend Basileus hotel to everyone! I will be back soon I hope and till then send my regards to Yusuf!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass_67
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Istanbul last month and stayed for 3 nights at the Basileus Hotel. My kids and I had just stayed in Paris at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe, and the last part of the trip was Istanbul, I had read all the reviews on TA about the Basileus Hotel, and was so happy to have got a reservation. The hotel is spotless clean, a little basic, especially after the Hilton, but it has everything you need. You can walk to all the sights in the historic part of town, and Yusuf will advise you what is a must, to do in Istanbul. I cannot say enough about Yusuf, he is very helpful and nothing is a bother ,not even changing light bulbs, he makes you feel like you are part of his family. Yusuf, thank you so much for all your great advice, our trip would not have been so memorable if not for you. I would highly recommend the Basileus, and I am looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “It was like visiting friends”
Reviews.Author: Vasilis_Chatzi
Reviews.Content: We visited istanbul from greece, with a couple of friends for four days. What makes this hotel really special, is the staff. They make you feel very welcome because they are very friendly, but not in a weird or uncomfortable way. We are greatfu fot their help in planning our days in the vast city of istanbul. Also the breakfast was a nice surprise, because it was plentyful in a cosy environment. Personally, I found the beds very helpful, because you could tell they were the expensive and anatomic kind that bend only around your body and not in half. resting is very important in istanbul. mark my words. Finally, it was brand new and really clean.

Reviews.Title: “I will never forget”
Reviews.Author: misscatfu
Reviews.Content: The location was walking distance to blue mosque and all the attractions in sultanahmet. We had a clean spacious affordable room. We had everything we need from a boutique hotel but the staffs made it even more special . I lost a few personal belongings throughout the trip and was feeling blue, the hotel owner and staff went out of their way to help us lift our moods. The staffs were so personable, warm and helpful, in the end I felt like I was staying at a good friend's house. Loved your work Yusuf!

Reviews.Title: “the most helpful and friendly stuff, spotless rooms, great location, reasonable price!! can't wait to go back!”
